Recipe Name: Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas and Vegetables
Description: A vibrant, nutrient-packed dish that's perfect for a light lunch or side.
Ingredients: 1 cup quinoa, uncooked. 1 � cups water. 1 cup canned chickpeas, rinsed and drained. 1 medium cucumber, diced. 1 medium red bell pepper, diced. 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. � cup red onion, finely chopped. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 teaspoon cumin powder, Salt and pepper to taste, 2 tablespoons fresh parsley
Instructions: 1. Rinse the quinoa under cold water in a fine mesh sieve. 2. In a medium pot, combine quinoa and water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes or until the water is absorbed. Fluff with a fork and let it cool. 3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, chickpeas, cucumber, bell pepper, cherry tomatoes, and red onion. 4. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, cumin, salt, and pepper. Pour over the salad and toss to combine. 5. Sprinkle with parsley if desired, and serve chilled or at room temperature.

Recipe Name: Spinach and Mushroom Whole Wheat Wrap
Description: A savory and satisfying wrap loaded with nutrients and flavor.
Ingredients: 1 large whole wheat tortilla. 2 cups fresh spinach. 1 cup mushrooms, sliced. � cup bell pepper, sliced. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 teaspoon garlic, minced. � cup hummus. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. 2. Add garlic and saut� for 1 minute. 3. Add mushrooms and bell peppers, and cook until soft. 4. Stir in spinach and cook until wilted. 5. Spread hummus on the wrap, fill with the vegetable mixture, season with salt and pepper, and roll tightly.

Description: A hearty and comforting soup full of flavor and fiber.
Ingredients: 1 cup lentils, rinsed. 4 cups vegetable broth. 1 onion, chopped. 3 carrots, diced. 3 celery stalks, diced. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 teaspoon thyme. Salt and pepper to taste. 2 tablespoons olive oil.
Instructions: 1. In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. 2. Add onions, carrots, and celery, and cook until softened. 3. Stir in garlic and thyme, cooking for 1 minute more. 4. Add lentils and vegetable broth, bring to a boil. 5. Reduce heat and simmer until lentils are tender, about 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper before serving.

Description: A light and refreshing salad full of protein and greens.
Ingredients: 1 boneless, skinless chicken breast. 4 cups mixed greens. 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. � cucumber, sliced. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. Season the chicken breast with salt and pepper. 2. Grill the chicken for 6-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through. 3. In a bowl, combine mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, and cucumber. 4. Whisk together olive oil and balsamic vinegar, and pour over the salad. 5. Slice the grilled chicken and add it to the salad before serving.

Description: A low-carb, refreshing dish perfect for a light lunch.
Ingredients: 2 medium zucchinis, spiralized. � cup fresh basil. � cup pine nuts. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 2 tablespoons nutritional yeast. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. In a blender, combine basil, pine nuts, olive oil, nutritional yeast, salt, and pepper, blend until smooth to make pesto. 2. Toss the zucchini noodles with fresh pesto. 3. Serve immediately, garnished with additional pine nuts if desired.

Description: A protein-packed and hearty sandwich that�s bursting with flavor.
Ingredients: 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained. � cup plain Greek yogurt. 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. 1 celery stalk, chopped. � red onion, finely chopped. Salt and pepper to taste. 4 slices whole grain bread.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mash chickpeas with a fork until chunky. 2. Stir in Greek yogurt, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, celery, red onion, salt, and pepper. 3. Spread the mixture on whole grain bread and assemble into sandwiches.

Description: A colorful stir-fry loaded with nutrients, served over brown rice.
Ingredients: 1 cup brown rice, uncooked. 2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, bell peppers, and carrots). 1 tablespoon soy sauce (low sodium). 1 tablespoon sesame oil. 1 teaspoon garlic, minced. 1 teaspoon ginger, minced.
Instructions: 1. Cook brown rice according to package instructions. 2. In a large skillet, heat sesame oil over medium heat. 3. Add garlic and ginger, cooking for 1 minute. 4. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender. 5. Stir in soy sauce and serve over brown rice.

Recipe Name: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos
Description: A filling and nutritious taco option that's easy to make.
Ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, cubed. 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained. 1 teaspoon cumin. 1 teaspoon paprika. 8 corn tortillas. 1 avocado, sliced. Fresh cilantro for garnish.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400�F (200�C) and spread sweet potatoes on a baking sheet. 2. Toss with cumin and paprika, and roast for 25-30 minutes until tender. 3. Warm tortillas and fill each with sweet potatoes, black beans, and avocado. 4. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

Description: A simple dish that�s quick to prepare and loaded with healthy fats.
Ingredients: 4 slices whole grain bread. 2 ripe avocados. 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. Salt and pepper to taste. 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Instructions: 1. Toast the bread. 2. Mash the avocados and season with salt and pepper. 3. Spread the avocado mixture on toasted bread. 4. Top with cherry tomatoes and drizzle with olive oil.

Description: A crunchy, tangy slaw that�s great as a side or topping.
Ingredients: 4 cups green cabbage, shredded. 2 carrots, grated. � cup apple cider vinegar. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon honey. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine cabbage and carrots. 2. In a separate bowl, whisk together vinegar, olive oil, honey, salt, and pepper. 3. Pour dressing over cabbage mixture and toss to combine. 4. Let it sit for at least 15 minutes before serving.

Description: A filling bowl with grains, vegetables, and zingy lemon dressing.
Ingredients: 1 cup quinoa, uncooked. 2 cups water. 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. � cucumber, diced. � cup kalamata olives, pitted and chopped. � cup feta cheese (optional). 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon lemon juice.
Instructions: 1. Rinse quinoa under cold water, then combine with water in a pot. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes. 2. In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa, tomatoes, cucumber, olives, feta (if using). 3. Whisk together olive oil and lemon juice, season with salt and pepper, and pour over the salad. Toss to combine.

Description: A low-carb alternative to fried rice that�s full of flavor.
Ingredients: 1 head cauliflower, grated into rice-like pieces. 2 cups mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, bell peppers). 1 tablespoon soy sauce. 1 tablespoon sesame oil.
Instructions: 1. In a skillet, heat sesame oil over medium heat. 2. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender. 3. Add cauliflower rice, stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, and stir in soy sauce before serving.

Description: A sweet and savory salad that�s perfect for summer.
Ingredients: 4 cups fresh spinach. 1 ripe peach, sliced. � cup walnuts, chopped. 2 tablespoons feta cheese (optional). 1 tablespoon balsamic vinaigrette.
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine spinach, peach slices, and walnuts. 2. If using, sprinkle feta on top. 3. Drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette and toss gently before serving.

Description: A protein-packed wrap filled with lean turkey and healthy fats.
Ingredients: 1 large whole wheat tortilla. 4 oz turkey breast, sliced. � avocado, sliced. 1 cup lettuce. 1 tomato, sliced. 2 tablespoons mustard.
Instructions: 1. Lay tortilla flat and spread mustard over it. 2. Layer turkey, avocado, lettuce, and tomato. 3. Roll tightly and slice in half before serving.

Description: Colorful and filling, these peppers are loaded with good-for-you ingredients.
Ingredients: 4 bell peppers. 1 cup quinoa, cooked. 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained. 1 cup corn. 1 teaspoon cumin. � cup salsa.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. Cut the tops off bell peppers and remove seeds. 3. In a bowl, combine quinoa, black beans, corn, cumin, and salsa. 4. Stuff the mixture into the bell peppers and place in a baking dish. 5. Bake for 30 minutes.

Description: Crispy falafel served with a creamy tahini sauce, rich in flavor.
Ingredients: 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained. 1 onion, chopped. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 tablespoon cumin. 1 tablespoon flour. 1 tablespoon olive oil. � cup tahini. 1 lemon, juiced. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. In a food processor, combine chickpeas, onion, garlic, cumin, flour, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth. 3. Form small balls and place on a baking sheet. 4. Bake for 25 minutes until golden brown. 5. Serve with tahini sauce made by whisking tahini with lemon juice, water, salt, and pepper.

Description: A refreshing cold soup packed with healthy ingredients.
Ingredients: 2 ripe avocados. 2 cups vegetable broth. 1 cucumber, peeled and chopped. 1 lime, juiced. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. In a blender, combine avocados, vegetable broth, cucumber, lime juice, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth. 2. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.

Recipe Name: Honey Mustard Chicken with Sweet Potato
Description: A delicious and hearty meal that's easy to prepare.
Ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts. 2 tablespoons honey. 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard. 2 medium sweet potatoes, cubed. 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. In a bowl, mix honey and mustard, then coat the chicken. 3. On a baking sheet, toss sweet potatoes with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 4. Bake chicken and sweet potatoes for 25-30 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and sweet potatoes are tender.

Description: A rich and creamy dessert with heart-healthy fats from avocados and antioxidants from dark chocolate.
Ingredients: 2 ripe avocados, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 cup maple syrup, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, a pinch of salt
Instructions: 1. In a blender, combine the avocados, cocoa powder, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and salt. 2. Blend until smooth and creamy. 3. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.

Description: A nutritious and filling pudding with omega-3s from chia seeds and antioxidants from berries.
Ingredients: 1/4 cup chia seeds, 1 cup almond milk, 1 tablespoon honey (or maple syrup), 1/2 cup mixed berries
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, whisk together chia seeds, almond milk, and honey. 2. Let it sit for 10 minutes and then stir again to prevent clumping. 3. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. 4. Serve topped with mixed berries.

Recipe Name: Oatmeal Cookies with Banana and Nuts
Description: Healthy cookies made with oats, ripe bananas, and nut butter, perfect for a sweet treat.
Ingredients: 2 cups rolled oats, 2 ripe bananas, mashed, 1/2 cup almond butter, 1/4 cup chopped nuts, 1/4 cup raisins or dark chocolate chips
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a bowl, combine oats, mashed bananas, almond butter, nuts, and raisins. 3. Drop spoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. 4. Bake for 15-20 minutes until golden.

Recipe Name: Fruit Salad with Lime and Mint
Description: A refreshing and light dessert bursting with seasonal fruits and a hint of lime.
Ingredients: 2 cups mixed seasonal fruits (e.g., berries, melon, kiwi), juice of 1 lime, 1 tablespoon chopped fresh mint
Instructions: 1. In a large mixing bowl, combine all the fruits. 2. Squeeze lime juice over the top and sprinkle with mint. 3. Toss gently and serve immediately.

Description: A warm dessert that features baked apples filled with oats, nuts, and spices.
Ingredients: 4 medium apples, 1 cup rolled oats, 1/2 cup walnuts, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/4 cup maple syrup
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. Core the apples and place them in a baking dish. 3. In a bowl, mix oats, walnuts, cinnamon, and maple syrup. 4. Fill the apples with the oat mixture. 5. Bake for 20-25 minutes until tender.

Description: A delicious smoothie packed with nutrients, great for breakfast or a snack.
Ingredients: 1 banana, 1 tablespoon peanut butter, 1 cup spinach, 1 cup almond milk, 1 tablespoon honey
Instructions: 1. In a blender, combine banana, peanut butter, spinach, almond milk, and honey. 2. Blend until smooth. 3. Serve immediately.

Description: Chewy coconut cookies with a hint of sweetness, made with shredded coconut and egg whites.
Ingredients: 2 cups shredded unsweetened coconut, 1/3 cup honey (or maple syrup), 2 egg whites, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 325�F (160�C). 2. In a bowl, mix all ingredients until well combined. 3. Scoop mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. 4. Bake for 15-20 minutes until lightly golden.

Description: Decadent truffles crafted with avocados and cocoa, offering a guilt-free indulgence.
Ingredients: 2 ripe avocados, 1/2 cup cocoa powder, 1/3 cup maple syrup, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine avocados, cocoa, maple syrup, and vanilla. 2. Mix until smooth and refrigerate for 1 hour. 3. Roll into small balls and dust with cocoa powder.

Description: No-bake energy bites with oats, flaxseed, and raisins for a quick and healthy snack.
Ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats, 1/2 cup peanut butter, 1/4 cup honey, 1/4 cup ground flaxseed, 1/2 cup raisins
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix all ingredients until well combined. 2. Roll into small balls and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. 3. Enjoy as a quick snack.

Recipe Name: Yogurt Parfait with Nuts and Honey
Description: A delightful parfait with layers of yogurt, nuts, and honey for a nutritious treat.
Ingredients: 1 cup low-fat yogurt, 1/4 cup mixed nuts, 2 tablespoons honey, 1/2 cup fresh berries
Instructions: 1. In a glass, layer yogurt, nuts, honey, and berries. 2. Repeat layers until all ingredients are used. 3. Serve immediately.

Description: A refreshing sorbet made from blended berries and natural sweeteners, perfect for a hot day.
Ingredients: 2 cups mixed berries (e.g., strawberries, blueberries), 2 tablespoons honey, 1 tablespoon lemon juice
Instructions: 1. In a blender, puree the berries, honey, and lemon juice until smooth. 2. Pour into a shallow dish and freeze for 2-3 hours. 3. Stir every 30 minutes until desired consistency is reached.

Description: A warm dessert made with baked apples and a crumbly oat topping for a comforting treat.
Ingredients: 4 cups sliced apples, 1 cup rolled oats, 1/2 cup almond flour, 1/4 cup honey, 2 teaspoons cinnamon
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a baking dish, layer sliced apples. 3. In a bowl, mix oats, almond flour, honey, and cinnamon. 4. Sprinkle over the apples and bake for 30-35 minutes.

Description: Healthy muffins with bananas and nuts, perfect as a snack or breakfast treat.
Ingredients: 2 ripe bananas, 1/2 cup almond flour, 1/2 cup oats, 1/4 cup chopped walnuts, 2 eggs, 1 teaspoon baking powder
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a bowl, mash the bananas. 3. Add almond flour, oats, walnuts, eggs, and baking powder, mixing well. 4. Fill muffin cups and bake for 20-25 minutes.

Description: A tropical treat featuring blended pineapple and coconut milk frozen into popsicles.
Ingredients: 2 cups fresh pineapple chunks, 1 cup coconut milk, 2 tablespoons maple syrup
Instructions: 1. In a blender, puree pineapple, coconut milk, and maple syrup until smooth. 2. Pour into popsicle molds and freeze for 4-6 hours. 3. To release, run warm water over the mold.

Description: A simple yet elegant dessert of strawberries dipped in dark chocolate for a sweet treat.
Ingredients: 1 cup fresh strawberries, 1/2 cup dark chocolate chips
Instructions: 1. Melt dark chocolate chips in a microwave or double boiler. 2. Dip each strawberry in melted chocolate and place on a parchment-lined tray. 3. Chill in the refrigerator until chocolate hardens.

Description: A moist and rich chocolate cake sweetened with applesauce and cocoa.
Ingredients: 1 cup almond flour, 1/2 cup cocoa powder, 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce, 3 eggs, 1 teaspoon baking powder
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a bowl, mix almond flour, cocoa, applesauce, eggs, and baking powder. 3. Pour into a greased cake pan and bake for 25-30 minutes.

Description: A simple and sweet treat featuring fresh grapes drizzled with honey.
Ingredients: 2 cups fresh grapes, 2 tablespoons honey
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, toss grapes with honey until evenly coated. 2. Serve immediately as a refreshing dessert.

Description: A juicy and flavorful grilled chicken dish seasoned with fresh herbs and lemon.
Ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts. � cup olive oil. 2 tablespoons lemon juice. 1 teaspoon garlic, minced. 1 teaspoon dried oregano. 1 teaspoon dried thyme. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper. 2. Marinate the chicken in this mixture for at least 30 minutes. 3. Preheat the grill to medium heat. 4. Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes on each side or until fully cooked. 5. Serve hot.

Description: A nutritious and easy-to-make baked salmon paired with healthy asparagus.
Ingredients: 4 salmon fillets. 1 bunch asparagus, trimmed. 2 tablespoons olive oil. Juice of 1 lemon. Salt and pepper to taste. 1 teaspoon garlic powder
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. Place salmon and asparagus on a baking sheet. 3. Drizzle with olive oil, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. 4. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until salmon flakes easily with a fork. 5. Serve immediately.

Description: A colorful mix of vegetables and protein-rich tofu stir-fried in a light soy sauce.
Ingredients: 14 oz firm tofu, cubed. 2 cups broccoli florets. 1 red bell pepper, sliced. 1 cup snap peas. 2 tablespoons soy sauce. 2 tablespoons sesame oil. 1 teaspoon ginger, minced. 2 cloves garlic, minced
Instructions: 1. Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat. 2. Add gingerc and garlic, saut� for 1 minute. 3. Add tofu and cook until golden brown. 4. Toss in broccoli, bell pepper, and snap peas, stir-fry for 5 minutes. 5. Add soy sauce, stir and cook for another 2-3 minutes.

Description: Bell peppers filled with a savory quinoa mixture, baked to perfection.
Ingredients: 4 large bell peppers (any color). 1 cup cooked quinoa. 1 can black beans, rinsed. 1 cup corn. 1 teaspoon cumin. 1 teaspoon chili powder. Salt and pepper to taste. 1 cup diced tomatoes.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove seeds. 3. In a bowl, combine quinoa, black beans, corn, cumin, chili powder, tomatoes, salt, and pepper. 4. Stuff the bell peppers with the mixture. 5. Bake for 30-35 minutes.

Description: A refreshing twist on pasta, using zucchini noodles topped with a healthy marinara sauce.
Ingredients: 4 medium zucchinis (spiralized). 2 cups marinara sauce. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 teaspoon garlic, minced. Fresh basil for garnish
Instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet, add garlic and saut� for 1 minute. 2. Pour in marinara sauce and let simmer for 5 minutes. 3. Add zucchini noodles and cook for another 3-4 minutes. 4. Serve hot, garnished with fresh basil.

Description: A hearty and spicy chickpea curry dish, packed with flavor and nutrients.
Ingredients: 1 can chickpeas, rinsed. 1 can coconut milk. 1 onion, diced. 2 tablespoons curry powder. 1 teaspoon garlic, minced. 1 teaspoon ginger, minced. 1 cup diced tomatoes. 2 tablespoons olive oil.
Instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a pot, add onion, garlic, and ginger, cook for 5 minutes. 2. Stir in curry powder and cook for 1 minute. 3. Add chickpeas, tomatoes, and coconut milk. 4. Simmer for 15-20 minutes. 5. Serve over brown rice.

Recipe Name: Stuffed Mushrooms with Spinach and Feta
Description: Savory mushrooms stuffed with a delicious blend of spinach, feta cheese, and herbs.
Ingredients: 16 large mushrooms, stems removed. 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped. � cup feta cheese, crumbled. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 teaspoon garlic, minced. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. In a skillet, heat olive oil, and saut� garlic and spinach until wilted. 3. Mix in feta, salt, and pepper. 4. Stuff mushrooms with the mixture. 5. Bake for 15-20 minutes.

Description: A wholesome, low-carb alternative to fried rice made with cauliflower.
Ingredients: 1 medium head of cauliflower, grated. 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, corn). 2 eggs, beaten. 2 tablespoons soy sauce. 2 tablespoons sesame oil. 1 teaspoon ginger, minced
Instructions: 1. Heat sesame oil in a large skillet. 2. Add grated cauliflower and mixed vegetables, saut� for 5 minutes. 3. Push to the side, pour beaten eggs into the empty side, and scramble. 4. Mix everything, add soy sauce and ginger. Cook for another 3-4 minutes. 5. Serve hot.

Description: A light and colorful pasta dish loaded with fresh vegetables.
Ingredients: 8 oz whole wheat pasta. 2 cups zucchini, diced. 1 cup bell peppers, diced. 1 cup cherry tomatoes. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Cook pasta according to package instructions. 2. In a skillet, heat olive oil, add vegetables, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper, saut� for 5-7 minutes. 3. Toss with the cooked pasta. 4. Serve warm.

Description: Roasted Brussels sprouts drizzled with a sweet balsamic glaze.
Ingredients: 1 lb Brussels sprouts, halved. 3 tablespoons balsamic vinegar. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 teaspoon garlic powder. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. Toss Brussels sprouts with olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. 3. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes. 4. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and roast for another 5 minutes. 5. Serve warm.

Description: A nourishing stew with cabbage and white beans for a comforting meal.
Ingredients: 1 small head of cabbage, chopped. 2 cans white beans, rinsed. 1 onion, diced. 4 cups vegetable broth. 2 carrots, diced. 1 tablespoon Italian seasoning
Instructions: 1. In a pot, saut� onion and carrots for 5 minutes. 2. Add vegetable broth, cabbage, white beans, and Italian seasoning. 3. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. 4. Serve warm.

Recipe Name: Grilled Shrimp Tacos with Mango Salsa
Description: Light and flavorful shrimp tacos topped with a refreshing mango salsa.
Ingredients: 1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined. 8 small corn tortillas. 1 ripe mango, diced. 1 avocado, diced. 1 lime, juiced. 1 teaspoon cumin
Instructions: 1. Season shrimp with cumin, salt, and pepper. 2. Grill shrimp until pink (about 3-4 minutes per side). 3. Warm tortillas and fill with grilled shrimp. 4. Top with mango and avocado. 5. Drizzle with lime juice and serve.

Description: A hearty salad with chickpeas and fresh spinach dressed with lemon vinaigrette.
Ingredients: 1 can chickpeas, rinsed. 4 cups spinach. 2 tomatoes, diced. 1 cucumber, diced. � cup red onion, sliced. 4 tablespoons olive oil. Juice of 1 lemon. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, spinach, tomatoes, cucumber, and onion. 2. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. 3. Pour dressing over salad and toss well.

Description: A nourishing bowl of quinoa topped with grilled vegetables and a tangy dressing.
Ingredients: 1 cup quinoa, uncooked. 2 cups mixed vegetables (zucchini, bell peppers, eggplant). 2 tablespoons olive oil. Juice of 1 lemon. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Cook quinoa per package instructions. 2. Toss vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper, grill until tender. 3. In a bowl, combine quinoa and grilled vegetables. 4. Drizzle with lemon juice and serve.

Description: A classic French vegetable dish packed with flavor and nutrition.
Ingredients: 1 eggplant, diced. 1 zucchini, diced. 1 bell pepper, diced. 1 onion, diced. 2 cups diced tomatoes. 2 tablespoons olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a large pot, add onion and saut� until translucent. 2. Add eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, salt, and pepper, cook for 10 minutes. 3. Stir in tomatoes and simmer for another 20 minutes. 4. Serve hot.

Description: A refreshing and creamy salad packed with healthy fats and protein.
Ingredients: 1 ripe avocado, diced. 1 cup canned chickpeas, rinsed and drained. 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped. 1 small cucumber, diced. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine avocado, chickpeas, red onion, and cucumber. 2. In another bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. 3. Pour dressing over the salad and gently toss to combine.

Description: Crunchy and aromatic, perfect for a quick and satisfying snack.
Ingredients: 1 cup raw almonds. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, chopped. Salt to taste.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a bowl, mix almonds with olive oil, rosemary, and salt. 3. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 10-12 minutes, stirring halfway.

Description: A creamy spread with veggies for dipping
Ingredients: 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained. 2 tablespoons tahini. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. 1 clove garlic, minced. Salt to taste. Assorted fresh veggies (carrots, celery, bell peppers).
Instructions: 1. In a blender, combine chickpeas, tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, and salt. 2. Blend until smooth. 3. Serve with fresh vegetables for dipping.

Description: No-bake, sweet, and chewy bites to energize you anytime.
Ingredients: 1 cup oats. 1/2 cup almond butter. 1/2 cup mixed dried fruits (raisins, apricots). 1/4 cup honey. 1/4 cup chia seeds.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix all ingredients until combined. 2. Roll into small balls. 3. Refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving.

Description: A creamy and nutritious snack loaded with protein and antioxidants.
Ingredients: 1 cup Greek yogurt. 1/2 cup mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries). 1 tablespoon honey. 1 tablespoon chia seeds.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, layer Greek yogurt and mixed berries. 2. Drizzle honey on top and sprinkle chia seeds.

Description: Simple yet satisfying, great for a quick bite.
Ingredients: 1 large apple, sliced. 2 tablespoons almond butter. Cinnamon for dusting.
Instructions: 1. Slice the apple and spread almond butter on each slice. 2. Sprinkle with cinnamon before serving.

Description: A nutritious and creamy pudding perfect for any time of the day.
Ingredients: 1/4 cup chia seeds. 1 cup almond milk. 1 tablespoon maple syrup. Fresh fruit for topping (optional).
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine chia seeds, almond milk, and maple syrup. 2. Stir well and let sit for 10 minutes. 3. Stir again and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Description: Crispy and healthy fries, perfect for munching.
Ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, cut into fries. 2 tablespoons olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 425�F (220�C). 2. Toss sweet potato fries with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 3. Spread on a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes until crispy.

Description: Fresh, crunchy cucumber slices topped with flavorful hummus.
Ingredients: 1 large cucumber, sliced. 1 cup hummus. Paprika for garnish.
Instructions: 1. Slice cucumber into thick rounds. 2. Top each slice with a dollop of hummus. 3. Sprinkle with paprika before serving.

Description: A quick and filling toast for a healthy snack.
Ingredients: 1 slice whole grain bread. 1 tablespoon peanut butter. 1/2 banana, sliced. Cinnamon for dusting.
Instructions: 1. Toast the slice of bread. 2. Spread peanut butter on toast and top with banana slices. 3. Dust with cinnamon before serving.

Description: Crispy and savory snack, perfect for munching guilt-free.
Ingredients: 1 bunch kale, stems removed. 1 tablespoon olive oil. Salt to taste.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. Toss kale with olive oil and salt. 3. Spread on a baking sheet and bake for 10-15 minutes until crispy.

Description: Light and nutritious with creamy avocado atop crunchy rice cakes.
Ingredients: 2 brown rice cakes. 1 ripe avocado, smashed. Salt and pepper to taste. Red pepper flakes (optional).
Instructions: 1. Spread smashed avocado on rice cakes. 2. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes if desired.

Description: A refreshing and crunchy snack with a tangy dip.
Ingredients: 2 large carrots, cut into sticks. 1/2 cup Greek yogurt. 1/2 cucumber, grated. 1 clove garlic, minced. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Salt to taste.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine Greek yogurt, cucumber, garlic, lemon juice, and salt to create tzatziki. 2. Serve carrot sticks with dipping sauce.

Description: A protein-rich, hearty salad great for a light snack.
Ingredients: 1 cup cooked quinoa. 1 cup canned black beans, rinsed and drained. 1/2 bell pepper, diced. 1/4 cup cilantro, chopped. 1 tablespoon lime juice. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine quinoa, black beans, bell pepper, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper. 2. Mix well and serve.

Description: Crunchy and spicy snack, high in protein.
Ingredients: 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 teaspoon paprika. 1 teaspoon cumin. Salt to taste.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. Toss chickpeas with olive oil, spices, and salt. 3. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes.

Description: A creamy and refreshing snack loaded with protein and sweetness.
Ingredients: 1 cup low-fat cottage cheese. 1/2 cup pineapple chunks. 1 tablespoon flaxseeds.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix cottage cheese with pineapple chunks. 2. Sprinkle flaxseeds on top and serve.

Description: A sweet treat with healthy fats and antioxidants.
Ingredients: 1 cup raw almonds. 1/2 cup dark chocolate (70% cocoa or higher), melted.
Instructions: 1. Dip each almond in melted dark chocolate. 2. Place on a baking sheet and refrigerate until set.

Description: A crunchy, healthy snack alternative to potato chips.
Ingredients: 2 medium zucchinis, thinly sliced. 1 tablespoon olive oil. Salt to taste.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 225�F (110�C). 2. Toss zucchini slices with olive oil and salt. 3. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for 2 hours, flipping halfway.

Recipe Name: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Brown Rice and Black Beans
Description: Colorful bell peppers filled with a hearty mixture of brown rice, black beans, and spices.
Ingredients: 4 bell peppers, halved and seeds removed. 1 cup brown rice, cooked. 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained. 1 cup corn, frozen or canned. 1 teaspoon cumin. 1 teaspoon chili powder. Salt and pepper to taste. � cup salsa. 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. In a bowl, mix together cooked rice, black beans, corn, cumin, chili powder, salt, pepper, and salsa. 3. Drizzle bell pepper halves with olive oil and place on a baking sheet. 4. Fill each bell pepper half with rice and bean mixture. 5. Bake for 25-30 minutes until peppers are tender.

Description: A lighter twist on the classic dish, baked instead of fried for a heart-healthy option.
Ingredients: 1 large eggplant, sliced. 1 cup marinara sauce. � cup part-skim mozzarella cheese, shredded. � cup grated Parmesan cheese. 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning. Salt and pepper to taste. Olive oil spray.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. Sprinkle eggplant slices with salt and let sit for 15 minutes to draw out moisture. Rinse and pat dry. 3. Arrange eggplant on a baking sheet, spray with olive oil, and bake for 25 minutes, flipping halfway. 4. In a baking dish, layer marinara sauce, baked eggplant, mozzarella, and Parmesan. Repeat layers and top with Italian seasoning. 5. Bake for an additional 20 minutes.

Recipe Name: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto and Cherry Tomatoes
Description: A fresh, low-carb dish perfect for a light lunch or dinner.
Ingredients: 2 medium zucchinis, spiralized into noodles. 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. � cup basil pesto (store-bought or homemade). 1 tablespoon olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. 2. Add zucchini noodles and cook for about 3-5 minutes until slightly tender. 3. Stir in cherry tomatoes and pesto until well combined. 4. Season with salt and pepper before serving.

Recipe Name: Overnight Oats with Almonds and Banana
Description: A convenient and heart-healthy breakfast option that�s ready when you are.
Ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats. 1 cup almond milk. 1 banana, sliced. 2 tablespoons sliced almonds. 1 tablespoon honey (optional). � teaspoon cinnamon.
Instructions: 1. In a jar or container, combine oats, almond milk, banana, honey, and cinnamon. 2. Mix well and refrigerate overnight. 3. In the morning, top with sliced almonds before serving.

Recipe Name: Baked Apples with Cinnamon and Walnuts
Description: A warm, comforting dessert that�s healthy and delicious.
Ingredients: 4 medium apples, cored. � cup walnuts, chopped. 2 tablespoons honey. 1 teaspoon cinnamon.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. Place cored apples in a baking dish. 3. In a bowl, mix walnuts, honey, and cinnamon, then fill each apple with the mixture. 4. Bake for 25-30 minutes until apples are tender.

Description: A satisfying and nutritious breakfast or snack layered with fruits and granola.
Ingredients: 2 cups Greek yogurt. 1 cup mixed berries. � cup granola (low-sugar). 1 tablespoon honey (optional).
Instructions: 1. In a glass or bowl, layer Greek yogurt, berries, and granola. 2. Drizzle with honey if desired. Repeat layers and serve.

Description: A delicious low-carb alternative to spaghetti, great with marinara.
Ingredients: 1 medium spaghetti squash. 2 cups marinara sauce. 1 tablespoon olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. Cut spaghetti squash in half, scoop out seeds, and drizzle with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 3. Place cut side down on a baking sheet and bake for 40-50 minutes. 4. Once done, scrape out flesh with a fork and serve topped with marinara sauce.

Description: A filling bowl packed with roasted veggies and quinoa, drizzled with tahini.
Ingredients: 1 cup quinoa, uncooked. 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, zucchini, carrots). 2 tablespoons olive oil. 2 tablespoons tahini. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 425�F (220�C). 2. Toss vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and spread on a baking sheet. Roast for 20-25 minutes. 3. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. 4. In a bowl, serve quinoa topped with roasted vegetables and tahini.

Description: A hearty stew filled with chickpeas and spinach, perfect for a comforting meal.
Ingredients: 2 cans chickpeas, rinsed and drained. 1 onion, chopped. 2 garlic cloves, minced. 4 cups vegetable broth. 4 cups spinach. 1 teaspoon cumin. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. In a pot, saut� onion and garlic until fragrant. 2. Add chickpeas, broth, spinach, cumin, salt, and pepper. 3. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes.

Description: A tropical and refreshing dessert that�s packed with nutrients.
Ingredients: � cup chia seeds. 2 cups coconut milk. 1 ripe mango, diced. 2 tablespoons honey (optional)
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine chia seeds, coconut milk, and honey. 2. Stir well and let it sit for 10 minutes. 3. Cover and refrigerate overnight. 4. Serve topped with diced mango.

Description: A hearty, comforting stew packed with protein-rich lentils and nutrient-dense spinach.
Ingredients: 1 cup dried lentils, rinsed. 4 cups vegetable broth. 2 cups fresh spinach. 1 medium onion, diced. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 2 medium carrots, chopped. 1 teaspoon cumin. 1 teaspoon paprika. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large pot, saut� onion and garlic until translucent. 2. Add carrots and cook for another 5 minutes. 3. Stir in lentils, broth, cumin, and paprika. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. 4. Add spinach and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Description: A simple yet flavorful dish featuring heart-healthy salmon and crisp asparagus.
Ingredients: 4 salmon fillets (4 oz each). 1 bunch asparagus, trimmed. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 lemon, juiced. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. 2. Drizzle salmon and asparagus with olive oil and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. 3. Grill salmon for about 4-5 minutes per side and asparagus for about 3-4 minutes, turning occasionally. Serve immediately.

Description: A warm and spicy curry made with chickpeas and fresh spinach, served over brown rice.
Ingredients: 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained. 2 cups fresh spinach. 1 can coconut milk (light). 1 medium onion, chopped. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 tablespoon curry powder. 1 cup brown rice. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Cook brown rice according to package instructions. 2. In a pot, saut� onion and garlic. 3. Stir in chickpeas, coconut milk, curry powder, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15 minutes. 4. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Serve over brown rice.

Description: A simple baked dish featuring lean chicken breast marinated in herbs and spices.
Ingredients: 4 chicken breasts (4 oz each). 2 tablespoons olive oil. 2 teaspoons dried oregano. 2 teaspoons dried thyme. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. In a bowl, mix olive oil, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper. 3. Coat chicken breasts in the mixture and place on a baking sheet. 4. Bake for 25-30 minutes until cooked through.

Recipe Name: Whole Wheat Pasta with Tomatoes and Spinach
Description: A wholesome pasta dish featuring whole wheat pasta, fresh tomatoes, and spinach.
Ingredients: 8 oz whole wheat pasta. 2 cups cherry tomatoes, halved. 2 cups fresh spinach. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 2 cloves garlic, minced. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Cook pasta according to package instructions. 2. In a large pan, heat olive oil and saut� garlic. 3. Add tomatoes and spinach, and cook until spinach wilts. Combine with pasta and season to taste.

Recipe Name: Baked Cod with Lemon and Dill
Description: A light and flavorful baked fish dish.
Ingredients: 4 cod fillets (4 oz each). 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 lemon, sliced. 2 tablespoons fresh dill, chopped. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. Drizzle cod fillets with olive oil, and season with dill, salt, and pepper. 3. Place lemon slices on top of the fish. 4. Bake for 15-20 minutes until the fish is cooked through.

Description: A low-carb rice alternative made from cauliflower and mixed vegetables.
Ingredients: 1 head cauliflower, riced. 2 cups mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, corn). 2 tablespoons olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a food processor, pulse cauliflower until it resembles rice. 2. Heat olive oil in a pan, add mixed veggies, and saut� for 5 minutes. 3. Add cauliflower rice, season, and cook for another 5-7 minutes.

Description: A delicious eggplant stuffed with quinoa, tomatoes, and spices.
Ingredients: 2 medium eggplants, halved. 1 cup cooked quinoa. 2 cups diced tomatoes. 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. Scoop out some flesh from eggplant halves. 3. Mix quinoa, tomatoes, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. 4. Fill eggplant halves and place in a baking dish. Bake for 25-30 minutes.

Description: A nutritious salad featuring roasted vegetables and whole wheat couscous.
Ingredients: 1 cup whole wheat couscous. 2 cups mixed vegetables (zucchini, bell peppers, onions). 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 teaspoon garlic powder. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. Toss vegetables with olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Roast for 25 minutes. 3. Cook couscous according to package instructions. 4. Combine roasted veggies with couscous, and serve warm.

Description: A refreshing salad with chickpeas and creamy avocado.
Ingredients: 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained. 1 avocado, diced. 1 small red onion, chopped. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine chickpeas, avocado, red onion, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Toss gently to combine.

Description: A vibrant stir-fry featuring chicken, turmeric, and ginger for a flavorful dish.
Ingredients: 4 chicken thighs, sliced. 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli). 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, grated. 1 tablespoon turmeric. 2 tablespoons soy sauce.
Instructions: 1. In a pan, heat soy sauce and add chicken. Cook until browned. 2. Add ginger and turmeric, and stir in vegetables. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes. Serve hot.

Description: A juicy and flavorful chicken dish marinated with lemon and fresh herbs, perfect for summer grilling.
Ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts. � cup olive oil. Juice of 2 lemons. 4 cloves garlic, minced. 2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, chopped. 2 tablespoons fresh thyme, chopped. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, rosemary, thyme, salt, and pepper. 2. Place chicken breasts in a resealable bag and pour marinade over the chicken. Seal and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. 3. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. 4. Remove chicken from marinade and discard marinade. 5. Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side or until cooked through. Let rest for a few minutes before slicing.

Description: Colorful skewers of assorted vegetables, lightly grilled for a smoky flavor, ideal as a side or vegetarian main dish.
Ingredients: 1 bell pepper, cut into chunks. 1 zucchini, sliced. 1 red onion, cut into wedges. 1 cup cherry tomatoes. � cup balsamic vinegar. 2 tablespoons olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste. Skewers
Instructions: 1. Preheat the grill to medium heat. 2. In a bowl, combine the vegetables. 3. In a small bowl, whisk together balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper. 4. Pour over the vegetables and toss to coat. 5. Thread the vegetables onto skewers. 6. Grill for about 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until the vegetables are tender and charred.

Description: A lightly seasoned salmon fillet, grilled to perfection and garnished with fresh dill for a heart-healthy meal.
Ingredients: 4 salmon fillets. 2 tablespoons olive oil. Juice of 1 lemon. 2 tablespoons fresh dill, chopped. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. 2. In a small bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, dill, salt, and pepper. 3. Brush the mixture onto the salmon fillets. 4. Grill salmon for about 5-6 minutes per side, or until cooked through and flaky. Serve with lemon wedges.

Description: Tender grilled shrimp served in corn tortillas with fresh toppings, creating a light and flavorful dish.
Ingredients: 1 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined. 2 tablespoons olive oil. Juice of 1 lime. 1 teaspoon chili powder. Salt and pepper to taste. 8 corn tortillas. 1 cup cabbage, shredded. � avocado, sliced. Fresh cilantro, for garnish
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine shrimp, olive oil, lime juice, chili powder, salt, and pepper. 2. Marinate for 20 minutes. 3. Preheat grill to medium heat. 4. Grill shrimp for 2-3 minutes on each side until pink and cooked through. 5. Serve shrimp in tortillas topped with cabbage, avocado, and cilantro.

Recipe Name: Grilled Quinoa and Black Bean Burgers
Description: Hearty and nutritious plant-based burgers that are grilled and served on whole-grain buns.
Ingredients: 1 cup cooked quinoa. 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained. � cup breadcrumbs. 1 small onion, finely chopped. 1 teaspoon cumin. Salt and pepper to taste. 4 whole-grain buns
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mash black beans with a fork. 2. Mix in quinoa, breadcrumbs, onion, cumin, salt, and pepper. 3. Form mixture into 4 patties. 4. Preheat grill to medium heat. 5. Grill burgers for about 5-6 minutes on each side. Serve on buns.

Description: Fresh asparagus spears tossed in olive oil and garlic, then grilled until tender and flavorful.
Ingredients: 1 bunch asparagus, trimmed. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 2 cloves garlic, minced. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat grill to medium heat. 2. In a bowl, toss asparagus with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. 3. Place asparagus on the grill and cook for about 5-7 minutes, turning occasionally until tender.

Description: A delightful salad featuring grilled peaches with mixed greens and a light dressing for a sweet touch.
Ingredients: 2 ripe peaches, halved and pitted. 4 cups mixed greens. � cup crumbled feta cheese. � cup balsamic vinaigrette
Instructions: 1. Preheat grill to medium heat. 2. Brush the peach halves with a little olive oil. 3. Grill peaches for 3-4 minutes on each side until grill marks appear. 4. Toss mixed greens with balsamic vinaigrette and top with grilled peaches and feta.

Description: Lean turkey burgers flavored with herbs and spices, grilled to make a satisfying meal.
Ingredients: 1 pound ground turkey. 1 teaspoon garlic powder. 1 teaspoon onion powder. Salt and pepper to taste. 4 whole-wheat buns. Lettuce and tomato, for serving
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix together ground turkey, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper. 2. Form into 4 patties. 3. Preheat grill to medium heat. 4. Grill turkey burgers for about 6-7 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Serve on buns with lettuce and tomato.

Description: Slices of grilled eggplant layered with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese for a healthy twist on a classic.
Ingredients: 1 medium eggplant, sliced. 1 cup marinara sauce. � cup part-skim mozzarella cheese, shredded. 2 tablespoons olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat grill to medium heat. 2. Brush eggplant slices with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. 3. Grill eggplant for about 4-5 minutes on each side until tender. 4. In a baking dish, layer grilled eggplant, marinara sauce, and mozzarella. 5. Bake in a preheated oven at 350�F for 15 minutes until cheese is melted.

Description: Thick slices of cauliflower grilled and seasoned, serving as a hearty vegan option.
Ingredients: 1 head cauliflower, sliced into 1-inch thick steaks. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 teaspoon cumin. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat grill to medium heat. 2. Brush cauliflower steaks with olive oil and sprinkle with cumin, salt, and pepper. 3. Grill for about 6-8 minutes on each side until tender.

Description: Juicy portobello mushrooms grilled and served with a balsamic glaze, making for a flavorful side.
Ingredients: 4 portobello mushroom caps. 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar. 1 tablespoon olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat grill to medium heat. 2. Brush mushrooms with olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper. 3. Grill for about 5-7 minutes on each side until tender and juicy.

Description: Strips of zucchini grilled to perfection and sprinkled with parmesan cheese for a savory side dish.
Ingredients: 2 medium zucchinis, sliced. 2 tablespoons olive oil. � cup grated parmesan cheese. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat grill to medium heat. 2. Toss zucchini slices with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 3. Grill for about 4-5 minutes on each side until tender. 4. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving.

Description: Juicy chicken breasts marinated in honey mustard and grilled until perfectly cooked.
Ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts. � cup honey mustard. 2 tablespoons olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix honey mustard with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 2. Coat chicken breasts in the marinade and let sit for 30 minutes. 3. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. 4. Grill each breast for 6-7 minutes per side or until cooked through.

Description: Whole-grain naan topped with fresh vegetables and mozzarella cheese, grilled for a quick and healthy meal.
Ingredients: 2 whole-grain naan breads. 1 cup marinara sauce. 1 cup assorted vegetables (peppers, onions, mushrooms). � cup part-skim mozzarella cheese.
Instructions: 1. Preheat grill to medium heat. 2. Spread marinara sauce on naan breads. 3. Top with vegetables and cheese. 4. Grill for about 5-7 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Description: A healthy wrap filled with grilled chicken and avocado, perfect for lunch or a light dinner.
Ingredients: 2 grilled chicken breasts, sliced. 1 avocado, sliced. 2 whole-wheat tortillas. 2 cups spinach. � cup Greek yogurt
Instructions: 1. Lay tortillas flat and spread Greek yogurt on each. 2. Layer with spinach, sliced chicken, and avocado. 3. Roll up tightly and slice in half to serve.

Description: Whole-grain flatbreads topped with hummus, grilled vegetables, and feta cheese, creating a delightful lunch option.
Ingredients: 2 whole-grain flatbreads. 1 cup hummus. 1 cup assorted grilled vegetables. � cup crumbled feta cheese
Instructions: 1. Preheat grill to medium heat. 2. Spread hummus on flatbreads. 3. Top with grilled vegetables and feta cheese. 4. Grill for about 5 minutes to warm everything through.

Description: Toasted bread topped with grilled tomatoes and fresh basil for a fresh appetizer.
Ingredients: 4 slices whole-grain bread. 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. 2 tablespoons olive oil. Fresh basil leaves, for garnish
Instructions: 1. Preheat grill to medium heat. 2. Brush bread with olive oil and grill for about 2 minutes per side until toasted. 3. Grill cherry tomatoes until they're softened. 4. Top toasted bread with tomatoes and fresh basil.

Description: A refreshing salad with the sweetness of strawberries and the richness of spinach, topped with a light dressing.
Ingredients: 4 cups fresh spinach, 1 cup strawberries, sliced, � cup walnuts, chopped, 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, 1 tablespoon olive oil, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine spinach and strawberries. 2. In a small bowl, whisk together balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper. 3. Drizzle dressing over salad and toss gently. 4. Top with walnuts before serving.

Description: A fresh Middle Eastern salad featuring bulgur wheat, tomatoes, and parsley.
Ingredients: 1 cup quinoa, rinsed, 2 cups water, 1 cup parsley, chopped, 1 cup tomatoes, diced, � cup cucumber, diced, � cup lemon juice, 2 tablespoons olive oil, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Cook quinoa in water according to package instructions. 2. Once cooled, mix quinoa, parsley, tomatoes, and cucumber in a large bowl. 3. In a small bowl, whisk lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper, then pour over the salad. Toss well.

Description: A classic Mediterranean salad with fresh vegetables and feta cheese, drizzled with olive oil.
Ingredients: 2 cups cucumbers, chopped, 2 cups tomatoes, chopped, � cup red onion, sliced, � cup Kalamata olives, � cup feta cheese, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar, Oregano, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a big bowl, combine cucumbers, tomatoes, onion, olives, and feta cheese. 2. In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper. 3. Pour dressing over the salad and toss gently.

Description: A simple and refreshing salad perfect for summer, bursting with fresh flavors.
Ingredients: 2 cups cucumbers, diced, 2 cups tomatoes, diced, � cup red onion, diced, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon vinegar, Salt, and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine cucumbers, tomatoes, and red onion. 2. In a separate bowl, whisk olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. 3. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.

Recipe Name: Roasted Beet and Goat Cheese Salad
Description: Sweet roasted beets paired with tangy goat cheese for a delicious and nutritious salad.
Ingredients: 2 cups roasted beets, sliced, � cup goat cheese, crumbled, 4 cups arugula, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine arugula, beets, and goat cheese. 2. In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper. 3. Drizzle dressing over the salad and toss gently.

Description: A crunchy and sweet salad full of flavors and textures, perfect for any meal.
Ingredients: 2 cups mixed greens, 1 large apple, diced, � cup walnuts, toasted, � cup feta cheese, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, apples, walnuts, and feta. 2. Whisk olive oil, cider vinegar, salt, and pepper together in a small bowl. 3. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.

Description: A vibrant salad packed with colorful vegetables and a nice sesame dressing.
Ingredients: 2 cups cabbage, shredded, 1 cup carrots, grated, 1 cup red bell pepper, sliced, � cup green onions, sliced, 2 tablespoons sesame oil, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, Sesame seeds for garnish
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix cabbage, carrots, bell pepper, and green onions. 2. In a small bowl, mix sesame oil, soy sauce, and rice vinegar together. 3. Pour dressing over salad and toss well.

Description: A hearty salad full of protein and packed with roasted veggies.
Ingredients: 2 cups cooked lentils, 1 cup roasted carrots, 1 cup roasted bell peppers, � cup red onion, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. Toss carrots and bell peppers with olive oil, salt, and pepper and roast for 25 minutes. 3. In a bowl, mix lentils with roasted veggies and drizzle with balsamic vinegar.

Recipe Name: Arugula Salad with Pears and Pecans
Description: A delightful salad showcasing peppery arugula with sweet pears and crunchy pecans.
Ingredients: 4 cups arugula, 1 large pear, sliced, � cup pecans, toasted, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large mixing bowl, combine arugula, pears, and pecans. 2. In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. 3. Drizzle dressing over and toss gently.

Description: A colorful salad with orzo, olives, and chopped veggies, dressed with lemon.
Ingredients: 1 cup orzo pasta, cooked, 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved, � cup cucumber, diced, � cup Kalamata olives, � cup feta cheese, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Cook orzo pasta according to package directions. 2. In a large bowl, combine cooked orzo, tomatoes, cucumber, olives, and feta. 3. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper, then pour over salad and toss.

Description: A crunchy slaw with sweet apples and crunchy cabbage, perfect as a side dish.
Ingredients: 2 cups green cabbage, shredded, 1 large apple, grated, � cup carrots, grated, 2 tablespoons yogurt, 1 tablespoon vinegar, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine cabbage, apple, and carrots. 2. In a separate bowl, mix yogurt, vinegar, salt, and pepper to make the dressing. 3. Pour over salad and toss to combine.

Description: A simple and classic Italian salad with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil, drizzled in balsamic.
Ingredients: 2 cups fresh mozzarella, sliced, 2 cups tomatoes, sliced, � cup fresh basil leaves, 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, 1 tablespoon olive oil, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Layer mozzarella and tomatoes on a plate, interspersing with basil. 2. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper before serving.

Recipe Name: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Salad
Description: A hearty salad packed with protein-rich black beans and sweet roasted potatoes.
Ingredients: 1 medium sweet potato, diced and roasted, 1 can black beans, rinsed, 1 cup corn, � cup red onion, � cup cilantro, 2 tablespoons lime juice, 1 tablespoon olive oil
Instructions: 1. Roast sweet potato until tender. 2. In a bowl, mix together sweet potato, black beans, corn, red onion, and cilantro. 3. Whisk lime juice and olive oil then pour over, tossing gently.

Description: A light and healthy salad with spiralized zucchini and a fresh herb dressing.
Ingredients: 3 cups zucchini, spiralized, 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved, � cup parsley, chopped, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine spiraled zucchini and tomatoes with parsley. 2. Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. 3. Pour dressing over salad and toss to coat.

Description: Earthy beets paired with creamy feta cheese create a delightful salad.
Ingredients: 2 cups roasted beets, diced, � cup feta cheese, crumbled, 4 cups spinach, � cup walnuts, chopped, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine beets, feta, spinach, and walnuts. 2. In a separate bowl, whisk olive oil and balsamic vinegar together. 3. Drizzle dressing over salad and mix gently.

Description: A nutrient-dense salad combining kale and quinoa with a zesty lemon dressing.
Ingredients: 2 cups kale, chopped, 1 cup quinoa, cooked, � cup cherry tomatoes, halved, � cup walnuts, chopped, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 tablespoon olive oil
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine kale, quinoa, tomatoes, and walnuts. 2. Whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. 3. Toss the salad with the dressing and serve.

Recipe Name: Pasta Salad with Spinach and Peppers
Description: A colorful pasta salad with fresh spinach and bell peppers, creamy and light.
Ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat pasta, cooked, 2 cups spinach, chopped, 1 cup bell peppers, diced, � cup Parmesan cheese, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine pasta, spinach, and peppers. 2. In a separate bowl, mix olive oil and vinegar, then pour over pasta salad. 3. Toss to combine and sprinkle with Parmesan.

Description: A colorful and refreshing salad packed with protein and fiber.
Ingredients: 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained. 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. 1 cucumber, diced. � red onion, finely chopped. � cup feta cheese, crumbled. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and feta. 2. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. 3. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Serve chilled.

Description: A quick and easy stir-fry that is vibrant, healthy, and full of flavor.
Ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots). 1 tablespoon olive oil. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 tablespoon soy sauce. 1 teaspoon ginger, minced. 1 teaspoon sesame oil. 2 green onions, sliced
Instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. 2. Add garlic and ginger, saut� for 30 seconds. 3. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry for about 5 minutes. 4. Add soy sauce and sesame oil, toss to coat. 5. Garnish with green onions and serve.

Description: A hearty bowl loaded with protein, fiber, and good nutrients.
Ingredients: 1 cup cooked quinoa. 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained. 1 bell pepper, diced. 1 avocado, sliced. 1 lime, juiced. 2 tablespoons cilantro
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine quinoa, black beans, and bell pepper. 2. Drizzle lime juice over the mixture. 3. Top with sliced avocado and cilantro before serving.

Description: A creamy, comforting dish made with barley and hearty mushrooms.
Ingredients: 1 cup pearl barley. 4 cups vegetable broth. 1 cup mushrooms, sliced. 1 onion, finely chopped. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 tablespoon olive oil. � cup Parmesan cheese (optional)
Instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat. 2. Saut� onion and garlic until translucent. 3. Add mushrooms and cook for another 5 minutes. 4. Stir in barley, then gradually add vegetable broth while stirring until barley is cooked. 5. Stir in Parmesan cheese if using, serve warm.

Description: Delicious and nutritious tacos filled with sweet potatoes and black beans.
Ingredients: 1 medium sweet potato, diced. 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained. 6 corn tortillas. � avocado, sliced. 1 teaspoon cumin. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 425�F (220�C). 2. Toss sweet potato with cumin, salt, and pepper. 3. Roast sweet potato for 20 minutes until tender. 4. Warm tortillas and fill with roasted sweet potato and black beans. Top with avocado.

Description: A sweet, creamy, and nutritious dessert that's easy to prepare.
Ingredients: 1 cup almond milk. � cup chia seeds. 1 ripe mango, diced. 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup (optional)
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine almond milk and chia seeds. Stir well and let sit for 10 minutes. 2. Stir again and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. 3. Serve topped with fresh mango and honey if desired.

Description: A healthy and satisfying snack perfect for sharing.

Instructions: 1. In a blender, combine chickpeas, tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, and garlic. Blend until smooth. 2. Transfer hummus to a bowl and serve with assorted raw vegetables.

Description: A low-carb alternative to traditional fried rice, loaded with veggies.
Ingredients: 1 head cauliflower, grated into rice-size pieces. 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, bell peppers). 2 tablespoons soy sauce. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 tablespoon sesame oil
Instructions: 1. In a skillet, heat sesame oil over medium heat. 2. Add garlic and saut� for about 30 seconds. 3. Add mixed vegetables, cooking until tender. 4. Stir in cauliflower rice and soy sauce, cooking for 5-7 minutes.

Description: A quick and filling breakfast that�s both heart-healthy and delicious.
Ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats. 2 cups water or almond milk. 1 banana, mashed. 1 tablespoon honey (optional). 1 teaspoon cinnamon
Instructions: 1. In a pot, bring the water or almond milk to a boil. 2. Stir in oats, reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. 3. Stir in banana, honey, and cinnamon. Serve warm.

Description: A creamy and nutritious pudding that's perfect for breakfast or dessert.
Ingredients: 1 cup coconut milk. � cup chia seeds. 1 tablespoon honey. � cup diced mango
Instructions: 1. Combine coconut milk and chia seeds in a bowl. 2. Stir in honey and let sit in the fridge for 4 hours or overnight. 3. Serve topped with mango.

Description: A light and satisfying omelet packed with vegetables and protein.
Ingredients: 4 egg whites. 1 cup spinach. 1 tablespoon olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. 2. Add spinach and cook until wilted. 3. Pour egg whites over spinach, season with salt and pepper. 4. Cook until set and fold in half.

Description: A refreshing salad that�s hydrating and light.
Ingredients: 2 cups cucumber, diced. 1 avocado, diced. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine cucumber and avocado. 2. Drizzle with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Toss gently to combine.

Description: A healthy and satisfying sushi filled with fresh vegetables.
Ingredients: 2 cups sushi rice, cooked. 4 sheets nori. 1 cucumber, julienned. 1 carrot, julienned. 1 avocado, sliced. Soy sauce for serving
Instructions: 1. Place nori sheet on a bamboo mat. 2. Spread an even layer of sushi rice over the nori, leaving 1 inch at the top edge. 3. Place vegetables in a line across the rice. 4. Roll tightly and seal the edge with water. Slice and serve with soy sauce.

Description: A hearty pasta dish loaded with protein and fresh vegetables, drizzled with a light dressing.
Ingredients: 8 oz whole wheat pasta. 1 cup canned chickpeas, rinsed and drained. 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. 1 cup spinach. 1/2 cup Kalamata olives, pitted and chopped. 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Cook whole wheat pasta according to package instructions. 2. In a large bowl, combine cooked pasta, chickpeas, tomatoes, spinach, olives, and feta cheese. 3. In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Drizzle over pasta and toss to combine.

Recipe Name: Spinach and Mushroom Whole Wheat Pasta
Description: A savory blend of spinach and mushrooms in a creamy sauce, perfect for a comforting meal.
Ingredients: 8 oz whole wheat linguine. 2 cups fresh spinach. 1 cup mushrooms, sliced. 1/2 cup low-fat Greek yogurt. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 tablespoon olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Cook linguine according to package instructions. 2. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat and saut� garlic until fragrant. 3. Add mushrooms and cook until tender, then add spinach and cook until wilted. 4. Remove from heat and stir in Greek yogurt, salt, and pepper. 5. Toss cooked linguine with the spinach mixture and serve.

Description: A light and zesty shrimp dish with whole wheat pasta, great for a quick dinner.
Ingredients: 8 oz whole wheat spaghetti. 1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined. 3 cloves garlic, minced. 1 tablespoon olive oil. Juice of 1 lemon. 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. Cook spaghetti according to package directions. 2. In a skillet, heat olive oil and saut� garlic until fragrant. 3. Add shrimp, lemon juice, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper, cook until shrimp turn pink. 4. Toss shrimp mixture with the cooked spaghetti and serve immediately.

Description: A fresh and vibrant dish combining spiralized zucchini and homemade pesto for a light meal.
Ingredients: 4 medium zucchini, spiralized. 1/2 cup fresh basil leaves. 2 tablespoons pine nuts. 1 clove garlic. 2 tablespoons olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a blender, combine basil, pine nuts, garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper, blend until smooth. 2. In a skillet, saut� spiralized zucchini for 2-3 minutes until tender. 3. Toss zucchini with pesto and serve warm.

Description: A colorful and nutritious pasta salad packed with veggies, perfect for meal prep.
Ingredients: 8 oz whole wheat pasta. 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. 1 cup bell peppers, diced. 1 cup cucumber, diced. 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Cook pasta according to package instructions. 2. In a large bowl, combine cooked pasta with tomatoes, peppers, cucumber, and red onion. 3. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over pasta and toss well.

Ingredients: 1 medium spaghetti squash. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese. 2 tablespoons olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. Cut spaghetti squash in half and remove seeds. Drizzle with olive oil and place cut-side down on a baking sheet. Roast for 40 minutes. 3. Once cooked, scrape the flesh into strands and toss with garlic, Parmesan, salt, and pepper.

Description: A fresh pasta salad featuring mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil, perfect for summer.

Description: A lower-calorie option for Alfredo using spiralized zucchini instead of pasta, with a creamy sauce.
Ingredients: 4 medium zucchini, spiralized. 1/4 cup low-fat Greek yogurt. 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese. 2 cloves garlic, minced. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a skillet, saut� garlic until fragrant. 2. Stir in Greek yogurt and Parmesan until combined. 3. In another skillet, lightly saut� spiralized zucchini for 2-3 minutes until just tender. 4. Combine zoodles with the sauce and serve.

Description: A nutritious and filling dish made with quinoa and black beans for added protein.
Ingredients: 8 oz quinoa pasta. 1 cup black beans, cooked. 1 cup corn. 1/2 cup diced red onion. 1/4 cup cilantro, chopped. 2 tablespoons lime juice. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Cook quinoa pasta according to package instructions. 2. In a large bowl, combine cooked pasta, black beans, corn, red onion, and cilantro. 3. Drizzle with lime juice and season with salt and pepper, toss to combine.

Instructions: 1. Cook pasta according to package instructions. 2. In a skillet, heat olive oil and add pumpkin puree, sage, salt, and pepper, cook until heated through. 3. Toss pasta with the pumpkin mixture and top with Parmesan before serving.

Ingredients: 8 oz whole grain pasta. 1 cup broccoli florets. 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. 1/2 cup basil pesto. 1/4 cup grated mozzarella cheese.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. Cook pasta according to package instructions. 3. In a large bowl, combine cooked pasta, broccoli, tomatoes, and pesto. 4. Transfer to a baking dish, sprinkle with mozzarella, and bake for 20 minutes.

Description: A creative twist on noodles using carrots and almonds, served with a light dressing.

Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine spiralized carrots and sliced almonds. 2. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Pour over carrot and almond mixture, tossing to combine.

Description: A classic dish with a healthy twist using whole wheat spaghetti and a fresh tomato sauce.
Ingredients: 8 oz whole wheat spaghetti. 2 cups diced tomatoes. 1/4 cup fresh basil, chopped. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 tablespoon olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. 2. In a skillet, heat olive oil, add garlic, and saut� until fragrant. 3. Add tomatoes, basil, salt, and pepper, cook until heated through. 4. Toss with cooked spaghetti and serve.

Description: A wholesome breakfast filled with fiber, antioxidants, and healthy fats.
Ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats. 2 cups almond milk. 1 cup mixed berries (blueberries, strawberries). � cup almonds, chopped. 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, Pinch of salt
Instructions: 1. In a saucepan, bring almond milk to a boil. 2. Stir in rolled oats and a pinch of salt. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for about 5 minutes until thickened. 3. Remove from heat and stir in cinnamon, honey, and half the berries. 4. Top with remaining berries and chopped almonds before serving.

Description: A quick, colorful dish that's easy to customize with your favorite vegetables.
Ingredients: 2 cups mixed veggies (broccoli, bell peppers, carrots). 1 tablespoon olive oil. 2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce. 1 teaspoon ginger, minced. 1 teaspoon garlic, minced., Cooked brown rice for serving
Instructions: 1. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. 2. Add garlic and ginger, saut� until fragrant. 3. Add mixed veggies and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes. 4. Stir in soy sauce and cook for another 2 minutes. Serve over brown rice.

Description: A protein-packed salad that is both filling and flavorful.
Ingredients: 1 cup cooked lentils. 1 cup diced cucumber. 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. � cup red onion, finely chopped. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine cooked lentils, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and red onion. 2. In a separate bowl, whisk together olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Pour over salad and toss to combine.

Recipe Name: Baked Sweet Potatoes with Black Beans
Description: A hearty, filling dish rich in vitamins and minerals.
Ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes. 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained. 1 teaspoon cumin. � avocado, diced. 2 tablespoons salsa, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. Pierce sweet potatoes with a fork and bake for 45-60 minutes until tender. 3. In a bowl, mix black beans, cumin, salsa, salt, and pepper. 4. Cut sweet potatoes open and fill with black bean mixture and diced avocado.

Description: A quick snack full of energy and flavor, perfect for on-the-go.
Ingredients: 1 cup dates, pitted. 1 cup nuts (almonds, walnuts). � cup oats. � cup shredded coconut. 1 tablespoon chia seeds
Instructions: 1. In a food processor, combine dates, nuts, oats, coconut, and chia seeds until finely chopped. 2. Form into small balls and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Enjoy as a snack.

Description: A quick and healthy breakfast option that can be prepared the night before.

Description: A low-carb, veggie-packed alternative to traditional spaghetti.
Ingredients: 1 medium spaghetti squash. 1 cup marinara sauce. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400�F (200�C). Cut spaghetti squash in half and remove seeds. 2. Brush with olive oil, season with Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Roast for 40 minutes cut side down. 3. Once cooked, scrape out flesh with a fork, mix with marinara sauce, and serve.

Ingredients: 1 cup cooked quinoa. 2 cups broccoli, steamed. 1 cup low-fat cottage cheese. 1 egg, beaten. 1 teaspoon garlic powder, Salt and pepper to taste

Description: A healthy, crunchy snack that's easy to prepare and satisfying.
Ingredients: 2 large carrots, cut into sticks. � cup hummus.
Instructions: 1. Serve carrot sticks alongside hummus for dipping.

Description: A creamy and healthy dip made from chickpeas, perfect for snacking.
Ingredients: 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained. � cup tahini. � cup olive oil. 2 tablespoons lemon juice. 1 garlic clove, minced. Salt to taste. Assorted veggie sticks (carrots, celery, cucumber)
Instructions: 1. In a food processor, combine chickpeas, tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, and salt. 2. Blend until smooth, adding water if needed to achieve desired consistency. 3. Serve with veggie sticks for dipping.

Recipe Name: Guacamole with Whole Wheat Pita Chips
Description: A creamy avocado dip paired with crunchy whole wheat pita chips.

Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C). Cut pita into triangles and bake until crisp. 2. In a bowl, mash avocados and mix in lime juice, red onion, tomato, jalape�o, salt, and pepper. 3. Serve with baked pita chips.

Description: Light and refreshing bites that are easy to make and eat.

Description: A mix of nuts and seeds that's perfect for on-the-go snacking.

Description: A refreshing and healthy parfait layered with peaches and yogurt.
Ingredients: 1 cup low-fat Greek yogurt. 1 medium peach, sliced. � cup granola (optional)

Ingredients: 2 medium beets, roasted and peeled. � cup walnuts. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Salt to taste

Recipe Name: Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Balsamic Glaze

Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 425�F (220�C). 2. In a bowl, toss sweet potato wedges with olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. 3. Place on a baking sheet in a single layer. 4. Bake for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway, until tender and golden

Description: A simple yet flavorful dish that's loaded with vitamins and antioxidants.

Instructions: 1. Steam broccoli florets until tender, about 5-7 minutes. 2. In a bowl, toss the steamed broccoli with olive oil, lemon zest, salt, and pepper. 3. Serve warm

Instructions: 1. In a pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. 2. Add mixed vegetables and saut� for 5 minutes. 3. Add quinoa and vegetable broth, bring to a boil, then reduce to simmer. Cover and cook for 15 minutes. 4. Fluff with a fork and season with salt and pepper

Description: A flavorful side dish with a hint of garlic and delicious roasted flavor.

Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 425�F (220�C). 2. In a bowl, mix cauliflower florets with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. 3. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25 minutes, flipping halfway through

Description: Bell peppers filled with a hearty mixture of quinoa and mushrooms.
Ingredients: 4 bell peppers, halved and seeded. 1 cup cooked quinoa. 1 cup mushrooms, chopped. 1 onion, diced. 1 tablespoon olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. In a pan, heat olive oil and saut� onions and mushrooms until soft. 3. Mix in cooked quinoa, salt, and pepper. 4. Stuff the bell pepper halves with the mixture and bake for 25 minutes

Recipe Name: Roasted Sweet Potatoes and Black Beans
Description: A colorful and hearty dish that's rich in fiber and flavor.

Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. Toss sweet potatoes with olive oil, cumin, salt, and pepper. 3. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes. 4. Mix in black beans before serving

Description: A protein-packed salad that's full of texture and flavor.
Ingredients: 1 cup cooked lentils. 2 carrots, grated. � cup parsley, chopped. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, mix lentils, grated carrots, and parsley. 2. In a smaller bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. 3. Pour dressing over the salad and mix well

Description: A hearty yet light saut� that offers great nutrition.
Ingredients: 4 cups fresh spinach. 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 2 cloves garlic, minced. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. 2. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. 3. Add chickpeas and saut� for 5 minutes. 4. Stir in spinach until wilted, then season with salt and pepper

Description: A nutritious and flavorful salad with a delightful crunch.
Ingredients: 2 medium beets, roasted and diced. 1/2 cup walnuts, chopped. 4 cups arugula. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine roasted beets, walnuts, and arugula. 2. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar, seasoning with salt and pepper. 3. Toss gently and serve

Ingredients: 1 cup couscous. 1 � cups boiling water. 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. 1 cup cucumber, diced. � cup olives, chopped. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon lemon juice
Instructions: 1. Place couscous in a bowl and cover with boiling water. Let sit for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork. 2. Add remaining ingredients and toss to combine

Description: A simple side that highlights the delicious flavor of fresh asparagus.

Instructions: 1. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. 2. Add garlic and saut� for 1 minute. 3. Add asparagus, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes until tender

Description: A sweet and crunchy salad that's a perfect side.
Ingredients: 2 cups grated carrots. � cup raisins. � cup Greek yogurt. 1 tablespoon honey. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Salt to taste
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix grated carrots and raisins. 2. In another bowl, combine yogurt, honey, lemon juice, and salt. 3. Pour dressing over carrots and mix well

Description: A refreshing salad perfect for picnics and barbecues.
Ingredients: 2 avocados, diced. 2 cups cherry tomatoes, halved. � cup cilantro, chopped. 2 tablespoons lime juice. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine avocados, cherry tomatoes, and cilantro. 2. Drizzle with lime juice and season with salt and pepper. 3. Toss gently and serve chilled
