Description: A colorful and tangy slaw featuring red cabbage and a zesty citrus dressing, great for adding brightness to any meal.
Ingredients: 4 cups red cabbage, shredded. 1 cup carrots, grated. � cup orange segments. � cup green onions, chopped. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 2 tablespoons lemon juice. 1 tablespoon orange juice. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine red cabbage, carrots, orange segments, and green onions. 2. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, orange juice, salt, and pepper. 3. Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture and toss to combine. 4. Serve immediately or let sit in the refrigerator for 15 minutes to allow flavors to meld.

Description: A bold and spicy take on traditional coleslaw, with a creamy sriracha dressing that adds a kick to any meal.
Ingredients: 4 cups green cabbage, shredded. 1 cup carrots, grated. � cup Greek yogurt. 2 tablespoons sriracha sauce. 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar. 1 tablespoon honey. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine the cabbage and carrots. 2. In a separate bowl, whisk together Greek yogurt, sriracha, apple cider vinegar, honey, salt, and pepper. 3. Pour the dressing over the cabbage and carrots, and toss to combine. 4. Refrigerate for at least 20 minutes before serving to allow flavors to develop.

Description: A healthy, creamy twist on classic coleslaw using avocado as the base for a delicious dressing, rich in healthy fats.
Ingredients: 4 cups green cabbage, shredded. 1 cup carrots, grated. 1 ripe avocado. 2 tablespoons lime juice. 2 tablespoons Greek yogurt. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine cabbage and carrots. 2. In a small bowl, mash the avocado and mix with lime juice and Greek yogurt until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste. 3. Pour the avocado dressing over the cabbage mixture and toss to combine. 4. Allow to sit for 10 minutes before serving for the flavors to meld.

Description: A crunchy and flavorful coleslaw with a sesame dressing that's perfect as a side or a light lunch.
Ingredients: 4 cups green cabbage, shredded. 1 cup carrots, grated. � cup red bell pepper, sliced. � cup sesame oil. 2 tablespoons rice vinegar. 1 tablespoon soy sauce. 1 tablespoon honey. 1 tablespoon sesame seeds. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine cabbage, carrots, and bell pepper. 2. In a separate bowl, whisk together sesame oil, rice vinegar, soy sauce, honey, salt, and pepper. 3. Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture and toss to combine. 4. Sprinkle with sesame seeds before serving.

Description: A delicious and heart-healthy cookie that combines oats and almonds for a chewy and nutty treat.
Ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats, � cup almond flour, � cup whole wheat flour, � cup honey, � cup unsalted almond butter, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, � teaspoon baking soda, � teaspoon salt, � cup chopped almonds
Instructions: 1. Preheat your oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a large bowl, mix the rolled oats, almond flour, whole wheat flour, baking soda, and salt. 3. In another bowl, combine honey, almond butter, and vanilla extract until smooth. 4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until well combined. Fold in the chopped almonds. 5. Scoop tablespoon-sized portions of dough onto a lined baking sheet. Flatten slightly and bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden. 6. Let cool on a wire rack before serving.

Description: Rich and fudgy cookies made with ripe avocados and dark chocolate for a satisfying treat without the guilt.
Ingredients: 1 ripe avocado, mashed, � cup unsweetened cocoa powder, � cup maple syrup, 1/2 cup almond flour, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, � teaspoon salt, � cup dark chocolate chips
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a large bowl, combine mashed avocado, cocoa powder, maple syrup, and vanilla extract until smooth. 3. Add almond flour, baking powder, and salt, mixing until combined. 4. Gently fold in dark chocolate chips. 5. Drop dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. 6. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Allow to cool on the sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.

Description: Soft and chewy cookies made with ripe bananas and whole grains, making for a nutritious snack.
Ingredients: 2 ripe bananas, mashed, 1 cup rolled oats, � cup whole wheat flour, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, � cup raisins, 1 tablespoon honey (optional), 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a large bowl, mix mashed bananas, oats, whole wheat flour, cinnamon, and vanilla extract until combined. 3. Fold in raisins and honey if using. 4. Scoop the mixture onto a lined baking sheet. 5. Bake for 10-12 minutes until lightly golden. 6. Allow to cool before serving.

Description: Gluten-free cookies made with chickpea flour, ensuring a protein-packed and fiber-rich treat for any time of the day.
Ingredients: 1 cup chickpea flour, � cup unsweetened applesauce, 2 tablespoons maple syrup, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, � teaspoon cinnamon, � cup walnuts (chopped)
Instructions: 1. Preheat your oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a bowl, mix chickpea flour, baking soda, and cinnamon. 3. In another bowl, combine applesauce, maple syrup, and vanilla extract. 4. Mix wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, then fold in walnuts. 5. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a lined baking sheet. 6. Bake for 12-15 minutes until set and lightly browned. Allow to cool on a rack before enjoying.

Description: A delightful combination of dates and mixed nuts, these cookies are sweet and crunchy, providing a healthy option for dessert.
Ingredients: 1 cup pitted dates, chopped, � cup mixed nuts (walnuts, almonds, pistachios), � cup rolled oats, � cup honey, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a bowl, combine chopped dates, mixed nuts, oats, honey, cinnamon, and vanilla extract. 3. Mix until all ingredients are well coated. 4. Scoop small amounts of the mixture onto a lined baking sheet, pressing gently to flatten. 5. Bake for 10-12 minutes, until slightly golden. 6. Let cool completely before serving.

Description: A healthier twist on traditional cornbread made with whole wheat flour and honey, providing a heart-friendly option for any meal.
Ingredients: 1 cup whole wheat flour. 1 cup cornmeal. 2 teaspoons baking powder. � teaspoon baking soda. � teaspoon salt. 1 cup unsweetened almond milk. 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar. 2 tablespoons honey. � cup applesauce. 1 large egg.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400�F (200�C). Grease an 8-inch square baking pan. 2. In a medium bowl, mix almond milk and apple cider vinegar, and let it sit for 5 minutes to curdle. 3. In a large bowl, whisk together whole wheat flour, cornmeal, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. 4. In another bowl, whisk the honey, applesauce, and egg. Add the almond milk mixture and blend well. 5. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry mixture, stirring until just combined. 6. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.

Recipe Name: Savory Cornbread with Spinach and Feta
Description: A deliciously hearty cornbread packed with nutrient-rich spinach and tangy feta cheese, perfect as a side dish.
Ingredients: 1 cup cornmeal. 1 cup whole wheat flour. 1 tablespoon baking powder. � teaspoon salt. 1 cup unsweetened almond milk. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 2 large eggs. 1 cup fresh spinach, chopped. � cup feta cheese, crumbled.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375�F (190�C). Grease a baking dish. 2. In a bowl, mix cornmeal, whole wheat flour, baking powder, and salt. 3. In another bowl, whisk the almond milk, olive oil, and eggs. 4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry mix and stir until combined. 5. Fold in the spinach and feta cheese. 6. Pour the batter into the dish and bake for 25-30 minutes until golden.

Description: Light, fluffy muffins made with whole grain cornmeal and fresh blueberries for a sweet yet health-conscious treat.
Ingredients: 1 cup cornmeal. 1 cup whole wheat flour. 2 teaspoons baking powder. � teaspoon salt. � cup honey. 1 cup unsweetened almond milk. 1 large egg. 1 cup fresh blueberries.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375�F (190�C). Line a muffin tin with paper liners. 2. In a bowl, mix cornmeal, whole wheat flour, baking powder, and salt. 3. In another bowl, whisk the almond milk, honey, and egg. 4. Combine the wet ingredients with the dry, followed by gently folding in the blueberries. 5. Divide the batter among muffin cups and bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

Description: A healthy cornbread recipe enhanced with chia seeds and spices for a nutritious and flavorful bite.
Ingredients: 1 cup cornmeal. 1 cup whole wheat flour. 2 teaspoons baking powder. 1 teaspoon cinnamon. � teaspoon salt. 1 tablespoon chia seeds. 1 cup unsweetened almond milk. � cup maple syrup. 2 tablespoons olive oil.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400�F (200�C). Grease a baking dish. 2. In a large bowl, mix cornmeal, whole wheat flour, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, and chia seeds. 3. In a separate bowl, whisk together almond milk, maple syrup, and olive oil. 4. Combine the wet ingredients into the dry and stir until just mixed. 5. Pour into the prepared baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden on top.

Description: A spicy and cheesy cornbread perfect for adding a kick to your meals, made healthier with reduced fat ingredients.
Ingredients: 1 cup cornmeal. 1 cup whole wheat flour. 1 tablespoon baking powder. � teaspoon salt. 1 cup unsweetened almond milk. 1 large egg. � cup reduced-fat cheddar cheese, shredded. 1 jalape�o, seeded and diced.
Instructions: 1. Preheat your oven to 400�F (200�C) and grease a baking pan. 2. In a bowl, combine cornmeal, whole wheat flour, baking powder, and salt. 3. In another bowl, whisk together almond milk and egg. 4. Mix the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until just combined. 5. Fold in the cheese and jalape�o. 6. Pour into the baking pan and bake for 20-25 minutes until golden.

Recipe Name: Crab Cakes with Avocado and Cilantro
Description: A flavorful and healthy twist on traditional crab cakes, incorporating fresh avocado and cilantro for an extra nutritional punch.
Ingredients: 1 pound lump crab meat. � cup whole wheat bread crumbs. 1 ripe avocado, mashed. � cup diced red onion. 2 tablespoons fresh cilantro, chopped. 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard. 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce. 1 egg, beaten. 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine the crab meat, bread crumbs, mashed avocado, red onion, cilantro, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and beaten egg. 2. Gently mix the ingredients until combined. 3. Form the mixture into patties. 4. Heat olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. 5. Cook the crab cakes for about 4-5 minutes on each side or until golden brown. 6. Serve warm with a lemon wedge and extra cilantro.

Description: A zesty version of crab cakes baked to perfection with a spicy kick, perfect for a heart-healthy meal.
Ingredients: 1 pound lump crab meat. � cup whole wheat panko crumbs. 1 egg, beaten. 2 tablespoons mayonnaise (light). 2 teaspoons hot sauce. 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard. 1 teaspoon garlic powder. 1 teaspoon onion powder. 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. In a large bowl, mix together the crab meat, panko crumbs, beaten egg, mayonnaise, hot sauce, Dijon mustard, garlic powder, onion powder, and olive oil. 3. Shape the mixture into cakes and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. 4. Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden and cooked through. 5. Serve hot with a side of fresh salad.

Description: Light and fresh, these crab cakes are loaded with Mediterranean flavors including feta cheese and olives, making them a perfect heart-healthy option.
Ingredients: 1 pound lump crab meat. � cup whole wheat breadcrumbs. � cup crumbled feta cheese. � cup chopped Kalamata olives. 1 egg, beaten. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 tablespoon lemon juice. 1 teaspoon dried oregano.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine the crab meat, breadcrumbs, feta cheese, olives, beaten egg, olive oil, lemon juice, and oregano. 2. Mix until well combined and form into patties. 3. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add olive oil. 4. Cook the crab cakes for about 4-5 minutes on each side until golden brown. 5. Serve with a side of tzatziki sauce.

Description: Combining the creaminess of avocado with the sweetness of crab, these cakes are excellent for a light dinner option.
Ingredients: 1 pound lump crab meat. � cup crushed whole wheat crackers. 1 ripe avocado, mashed. 1 egg, beaten. 2 tablespoons lime juice. 1 teaspoon chili powder. 1 tablespoon cilantro, chopped.
Instructions: 1. In a mixing bowl, add crab meat, crushed crackers, mashed avocado, beaten egg, lime juice, chili powder, and cilantro. 2. Form mixture into small cakes. 3. Heat a skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with olive oil. 4. Cook crab cakes for about 4 minutes on each side until browned. 5. Serve with a fresh salad.

Description: A tropical twist, these crab cakes are crusted with unsweetened coconut, providing a unique flavor and texture.
Ingredients: 1 pound lump crab meat. � cup almond flour. � cup unsweetened shredded coconut. 1 egg, beaten. 2 tablespoons lime juice. 1 teaspoon garlic powder. 2 tablespoons olive oil.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix together crab meat, almond flour, shredded coconut, beaten egg, lime juice, and garlic powder. 2. Form into patties and refrigerate for 15 minutes. 3. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. 4. Cook the cakes for approximately 4-5 minutes on each side until golden brown. 5. Serve warm with a mango salsa.

Description: A unique twist on the classic dessert, using avocados for creaminess while being heart-healthy.
Ingredients: 2 ripe avocados. 1 cup unsweetened almond milk. 1/4 cup honey or agave syrup. 2 teaspoons vanilla extract. 1 tablespoon cornstarch. 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 325�F (160�C). 2. In a blender, combine avocados, almond milk, honey, vanilla extract, cornstarch, and salt. Blend until smooth. 3. Pour the mixture into ramekins. 4. Place the ramekins in a baking dish and fill the dish with hot water halfway up the sides of the ramekins. 5. Bake for 30 minutes, or until set. 6. Remove from the oven and let cool. 7. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. 8. To caramelize the top, sprinkle a thin layer of sugar on each ramekin and use a kitchen torch to melt and caramelize the sugar.

Description: A delightful and nutritious version of creme brulee, featuring creamy coconut and crunchy chia seeds.
Ingredients: 1 can (13.5 oz) coconut milk. 1/3 cup chia seeds. 1/4 cup maple syrup. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. 1/4 cup sugar for caramelizing.
Instructions: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine coconut milk, chia seeds, maple syrup, and vanilla. Stir well and let it sit for about 10 minutes for the chia to absorb liquid. 2. Divide the mixture into ramekins and refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight to set. 3. When ready to serve, preheat the broiler. 4. Sprinkle sugar evenly over the top of each ramekin. 5. Place under the broiler for 1-2 minutes until the sugar caramelizes. 6. Let cool for a few minutes before serving.

Description: A wholesome breakfast dessert that combines the richness of custard with the heart-healthy benefits of oats.
Ingredients: 2 cups cooked oatmeal (rolled oats). 1 cup unsweetened almond milk. 1/4 cup honey or maple syrup. 2 eggs. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. 1/4 cup brown sugar for topping.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a large bowl, mix cooked oatmeal with almond milk, honey, eggs, and vanilla. 3. Divide the mixture into ramekins. 4. Place the ramekins in a baking dish and add hot water until halfway up the sides of the ramekins. 5. Bake for about 30 minutes, until the center is set. 6. Remove from the oven, let cool, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. 7. Before serving, sprinkle brown sugar on top and torch until caramelized.

Description: A healthy and fruity take on traditional creme brulee, featuring yogurt and berries for a nutritious dessert.
Ingredients: 2 cups Greek yogurt. 1/2 cup mixed berries (fresh or frozen). 1/4 cup honey. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. 1/4 cup sugar for caramelizing.
Instructions: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine Greek yogurt, honey, vanilla, and mixed berries, mashing slightly to release berry juices. 2. Divide the mixture into ramekins. 3. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours to set. 4. Before serving, sprinkle sugar evenly on top of each ramekin. 5. Use a kitchen torch to caramelize the sugar for a crispy top.

Description: A seasonal delight combining the flavors of pumpkin and spices in a heart-healthy cream.
Ingredients: 1 cup pumpkin puree. 1 cup unsweetened almond milk. 1/4 cup maple syrup. 2 eggs. 1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice. 1/4 cup sugar for caramelizing.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 325�F (160�C). 2. In a bowl, whisk together pumpkin puree, almond milk, maple syrup, eggs, and pumpkin pie spice. 3. Pour the mixture into ramekins. 4. Place the ramekins in a baking dish and add hot water to halfway up the sides. 5. Bake for 30-35 minutes until the mixture is set. 6. Cool, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours. 7. Sprinkle sugar on top and torch to caramelize.

Description: A warm, comforting dessert that combines the sweetness of baked apples with a crunchy oat topping.
Ingredients: 4 cups apples, peeled and sliced. 1 cup rolled oats. � cup whole wheat flour. � cup walnuts, chopped. � cup honey or maple syrup. 1 tablespoon cinnamon. � teaspoon salt. 3 tablespoons coconut oil, melted. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a mixing bowl, combine sliced apples, honey or maple syrup, and cinnamon. Mix well and spread evenly in a greased baking dish. 3. In another bowl, combine oats, whole wheat flour, walnuts, salt, melted coconut oil, and vanilla extract. Mix until crumbly. 4. Sprinkle the oat mixture over the apples. 5. Bake for 30-35 minutes until the topping is golden and the apples are tender. Serve warm.

Description: A delicious blend of mixed berries topped with a crunchy almond and oat topping, ideal for brunch or dessert.
Ingredients: 2 cups mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries). 1 cup rolled oats. � cup almond flour. � cup almond butter. � cup honey or maple syrup. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. � teaspoon cinnamon. � teaspoon salt
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. In a bowl, mix together mixed berries, honey or maple syrup, and vanilla extract. Spread them evenly in a greased baking dish. 3. In another bowl, combine rolled oats, almond flour, cinnamon, salt, and almond butter. Mix until crumbly. 4. Sprinkle the oat mixture over the berry layer. 5. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. Allow to cool before serving.

Description: A unique dessert combining summer peaches with quinoa for a hearty and healthy twist.
Ingredients: 4 cups peaches, peeled and sliced. 1 cup cooked quinoa. � cup rolled oats. � cup brown sugar or coconut sugar. � teaspoon cinnamon. � cup chopped pecans. 2 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a large mixing bowl, combine peaches, cooked quinoa, and brown sugar. Toss well and spread in a greased baking dish. 3. In another bowl, mix oats, cinnamon, and chopped pecans. Stir in melted coconut oil until mixed. 4. Spread oat mixture over the peach layer. 5. Bake for 30-35 minutes until topping is golden and peaches are bubbly. Serve warm.

Description: A nutritious, heart-healthy breakfast that combines bananas and nuts with crunchy oats.
Ingredients: 2 ripe bananas, mashed. 1 cup rolled oats. � cup walnuts, chopped. � cup honey or maple syrup. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. � teaspoon cinnamon. � teaspoon salt.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a large bowl, mix all ingredients until well combined. 3. Spread the mixture on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. 4. Bake for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally until golden brown. 5. Let cool and serve with milk or yogurt.

Description: A vibrant and healthy dessert that combines carrots with ginger for a warm and flavorful treat.
Ingredients: 3 cups grated carrots. 1 cup rolled oats. � cup whole wheat flour. � cup brown sugar. 1 tablespoon ginger, grated. � teaspoon cinnamon. � cup coconut oil, melted. � cup raisins
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a bowl, mix grated carrots, ginger, brown sugar, and raisins. Spread in a greased baking dish. 3. In another bowl, combine oats, whole wheat flour, cinnamon, and melted coconut oil. Mix until crumbly. 4. Sprinkle topping over the carrot mixture. 5. Bake for 30-35 minutes until golden brown. Serve warm.

Description: Moist and rich chocolate cupcakes made with avocado for healthy fats and natural sweetness.
Ingredients: 1 cup whole wheat flour. � cup unsweetened cocoa powder. 1 teaspoon baking soda. � teaspoon salt. 1 ripe avocado, mashed. � cup honey or maple syrup. 2 large eggs. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. � cup unsweetened applesauce. � cup almond milk
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and line a cupcake tin with liners. 2. In a bowl, mix flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. 3. In another bowl, combine mashed avocado, honey/maple syrup, eggs, vanilla, and applesauce. Blend until smooth. 4. Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients and mix until just combined. 5. Gradually stir in almond milk until the batter is smooth. 6. Divide the batter into the cupcake liners. Bake for 18-20 minutes. Cool before serving.

Description: Deliciously moist cupcakes made with ripe bananas and oats for a fiber-rich treat.
Ingredients: 2 ripe bananas, mashed. 1 cup rolled oats. � cup whole wheat flour. � teaspoon baking powder. � teaspoon baking soda. � teaspoon salt. 2 tablespoons olive oil. � cup honey or maple syrup. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. � cup almond milk
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and line a cupcake tin with liners. 2. In a bowl, combine mashed bananas, olive oil, honey/maple syrup, vanilla, and almond milk. 3. In another bowl, mix oats, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. 4. Fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until just combined. 5. Pour the batter into the cupcake liners and bake for 20-25 minutes. Allow to cool before serving.

Description: Moist cupcakes packed with carrots and almond flour, making for a wholesome snack.
Ingredients: 1 cup almond flour. 1 cup grated carrots. � cup honey or maple syrup. � cup unsweetened applesauce. 2 large eggs. 1 teaspoon baking powder. � teaspoon baking soda. � teaspoon cinnamon. � teaspoon salt
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and line a cupcake tin with liners. 2. In a bowl, mix almond flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. 3. In another bowl, combine grated carrots, honey/maple syrup, applesauce, and eggs. 4. Mix the wet and dry ingredients until combined. 5. Distribute the batter evenly into the cupcake liners and bake for 18-20 minutes. Let cool before serving.

Description: Fluffy cupcakes made with sweet potatoes and spices for a naturally sweet option.
Ingredients: 1 cup mashed sweet potato. 1 cup whole wheat flour. � cup honey or maple syrup. � teaspoon baking powder. � teaspoon cinnamon. � teaspoon nutmeg. 2 large eggs. � cup almond milk. � teaspoon salt
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and line a cupcake tin with liners. 2. In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt. 3. In another bowl, combine the sweet potato, honey/maple syrup, eggs, and almond milk. 4. Stir the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until combined. 5. Pour the batter into the cupcake liners and bake for 20-25 minutes. Cool before serving.

Description: A moist treat with added veggies for extra fiber and nutrition.
Ingredients: 1 cup grated zucchini. � cup whole wheat flour. � cup almond flour. � cup honey or maple syrup. � teaspoon baking powder. � teaspoon baking soda. 1 teaspoon cinnamon. 2 large eggs. � teaspoon salt
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and line a cupcake tin with liners. 2. In a bowl, combine the flours, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. 3. In another bowl, whisk together grated zucchini, honey/maple syrup, and eggs. 4. Mix the wet and dry ingredients until just combined. 5. Fill the cupcake liners and bake for 20-22 minutes. Allow to cool before serving.

Recipe Name: Heart-Healthy Danish with Spinach and Feta
Description: A deliciously flaky pastry filled with nutritious spinach and feta cheese, perfect for a light lunch or snack.
Ingredients: 1 sheet whole grain puff pastry, thawed. 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped. 1 cup feta cheese, crumbled. 1 egg, beaten. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 clove garlic, minced. � teaspoon black pepper. � teaspoon nutmeg. 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and saut� until fragrant. 3. Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted. Remove from heat and let cool. 4. In a bowl, mix together the wilted spinach, feta cheese, egg, black pepper, nutmeg, and dill. 5. Roll out the puff pastry and cut into squares. Place a spoonful of filling in the center. Fold corners to meet in the center and seal. 6. Place on a baking sheet and brush with remaining egg wash. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.

Recipe Name: Heart-Healthy Danish with Blueberries and Oats
Description: A wholesome pastry made with whole grain oats and fresh blueberries for a satisfying breakfast treat.
Ingredients: 1 sheet whole grain puff pastry, thawed. 1 cup fresh blueberries. � cup rolled oats. 2 tablespoons honey or maple syrup. 1 tablespoon Greek yogurt. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. � teaspoon cinnamon.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. In a bowl, mix rolled oats, honey, Greek yogurt, vanilla extract, and cinnamon until well combined. 3. Roll out the puff pastry and cut into circles. 4. Place a spoonful of the oat mixture and a few blueberries in the center of each circle. 5. Fold the edges slightly to create a border. 6. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the pastry is golden and the blueberries are bubbly.

Recipe Name: Heart-Healthy Danish with Almond and Apricot
Description: A delightful pastry featuring a filling of ground almonds and sweet apricot preserves, ideal for a snack or dessert.
Ingredients: 1 sheet whole grain puff pastry, thawed. � cup ground almonds. � cup apricot preserves. 1 egg, beaten. 1 tablespoon honey. � teaspoon almond extract.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. In a bowl, combine ground almonds, apricot preserves, honey, and almond extract. 3. Roll out the puff pastry and cut into squares. 4. Place a spoonful of the almond filling in the center of each square and fold diagonally to form a triangle. 5. Seal edges with a fork and brush with egg wash. 6. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.

Recipe Name: Heart-Healthy Danish with Ricotta and Raspberries
Description: A creamy and fruity pastry that combines ricotta cheese with fresh raspberries, great for breakfast or a sweet treat.
Ingredients: 1 sheet whole grain puff pastry, thawed. 1 cup ricotta cheese. 1 cup fresh raspberries. 2 tablespoons honey. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. � teaspoon lemon zest.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese, honey, vanilla extract, and lemon zest until smooth. 3. Roll out the puff pastry and cut into rectangles. 4. Place a dollop of ricotta mixture and a few raspberries in the center of each rectangle. 5. Fold edges to partially enclose filling. 6. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until pastry is golden and puffed.

Recipe Name: Heart-Healthy Danish with Dark Chocolate and Walnuts
Description: A rich yet wholesome pastry featuring dark chocolate and walnuts, providing a deliciously satisfying and heart-healthy option.
Ingredients: 1 sheet whole grain puff pastry, thawed. � cup dark chocolate chips. � cup walnuts, chopped. 1 tablespoon coconut oil. 1 egg, beaten.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. Melt dark chocolate and coconut oil in a microwave or double boiler until smooth. 3. In a bowl, mix melted chocolate and chopped walnuts. 4. Roll out the puff pastry and cut into squares. 5. Place a spoonful of the chocolate mixture in the center of each square and fold corners to meet in the center. 6. Brush with egg wash and bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden.

Description: A delicious twist on classic deviled eggs, using creamy avocado instead of mayonnaise for a heart-healthy option.
Ingredients: 6 large eggs. 1 ripe avocado. 1 tablespoon lime juice. 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard. Salt and pepper to taste. Paprika for garnish
Instructions: 1. Hard boil the eggs by placing them in a pot of water, bringing to a boil, then covering and letting sit for 10-12 minutes. 2. After cooking, transfer the eggs to an ice bath to cool. 3. Peel the eggs and slice them in half lengthwise. 4. In a bowl, scoop out the yolks and mash them with avocado, lime juice, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper until smooth. 5. Spoon or pipe the avocado mixture back into the egg whites and sprinkle with paprika. Serve chilled.

Description: A lighter version of deviled eggs that incorporates Greek yogurt for creaminess and a boost of protein.
Ingredients: 6 large eggs. 3 tablespoons Greek yogurt. 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard. 1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar. Salt and pepper to taste. Chives for garnish
Instructions: 1. Hard boil the eggs by placing them in a pot of water, bringing to a boil, then covering and letting sit for 10-12 minutes. 2. Transfer the eggs to an ice bath to cool, then peel and slice them in half lengthwise. 3. Remove the yolks and combine them in a bowl with Greek yogurt, mustard, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Mix until smooth. 4. Spoon or pipe the mixture back into the egg whites and top with chopped chives. Serve chilled.

Description: A flavorful spin on deviled eggs, flavored with curry powder for an exotic taste.
Ingredients: 6 large eggs. 3 tablespoons plain yogurt. 1 teaspoon curry powder. 1 tablespoon lime juice. Salt to taste. Fresh cilantro for garnish
Instructions: 1. Hard boil the eggs by placing them in a pot of water, bringing to a boil, then covering and letting sit for 10-12 minutes. 2. Transfer the eggs to an ice bath to cool and then peel and slice them in half lengthwise. 3. Remove the yolks and combine them in a bowl with yogurt, curry powder, lime juice, and salt. Mix until smooth. 4. Spoon or pipe the mixture back into the egg whites and garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve chilled.

Recipe Name: Deviled Eggs with Spinach and Feta
Description: A nutritious version of deviled eggs packed with spinach and feta cheese for added flavor and health benefits.
Ingredients: 6 large eggs. 1 cup spinach, cooked and chopped. 2 tablespoons feta cheese, crumbled. 1 tablespoon Greek yogurt. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Hard boil the eggs by placing them in a pot of water, bringing to a boil, then covering and letting sit for 10-12 minutes. 2. Transfer the eggs to an ice bath to cool and then peel and slice them in half lengthwise. 3. Remove the yolks and combine them in a bowl with spinach, feta, Greek yogurt, salt, and pepper. Mix well. 4. Spoon or pipe the mixture back into the egg whites and serve chilled.

Recipe Name: Deviled Eggs with Roasted Red Pepper
Description: A colorful and flavorful variation of deviled eggs featuring roasted red peppers for a tasty kick.
Ingredients: 6 large eggs. 2 tablespoons roasted red pepper, finely chopped. 2 tablespoons plain yogurt. 1 teaspoon mustard. Salt and pepper to taste. Fresh parsley for garnish
Instructions: 1. Hard boil the eggs by placing them in a pot of water, bringing to a boil, then covering and letting sit for 10-12 minutes. 2. Transfer the eggs to an ice bath to cool and then peel and slice them in half lengthwise. 3. Remove the yolks and combine them in a bowl with roasted red pepper, yogurt, mustard, salt, and pepper. Mix until smooth. 4. Spoon or pipe the mixture back into the egg whites and garnish with parsley. Serve chilled.

Description: A delightful spin on traditional doughnuts, packed with wholesome ingredients and the warm flavors of apple and cinnamon.
Ingredients: 1 cup whole wheat flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce, 1/4 cup honey or maple syrup, 1/4 cup almond milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1/2 cup chopped walnuts
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and lightly grease a doughnut pan. 2. In a large bowl, mix flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. 3. In another bowl, whisk together applesauce, honey, almond milk, and vanilla extract. 4. Combine the wet and dry ingredients until just mixed. Stir in the walnuts. 5. Pour the batter into the prepared doughnut pan and bake for 15-20 minutes. 6. Let cool before removing from pan, serve warm or at room temperature.

Description: A rich, guilt-free dessert that uses avocado for creaminess and healthy fats, ensuring a satisfying treat.
Ingredients: 1 cup whole wheat flour, 1/2 cup cocoa powder, 1 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp salt, 1 ripe avocado, mashed, 1/4 cup honey, 1/4 cup almond milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and prepare a doughnut pan. 2. In a medium bowl, combine flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. 3. In another bowl, beat mashed avocado, honey, almond milk, and vanilla until smooth. 4. Mix the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until just combined. 5. Spoon the batter into the doughnut pan and bake for 12-15 minutes. 6. Allow to cool and enjoy your delicious chocolate treat.

Description: These doughnuts are filled with the goodness of bananas and oats, providing a fiber-rich snack that satisfies cravings.
Ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats, 1/2 cup whole wheat flour, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1 ripe banana, mashed, 1/4 cup honey or maple syrup, 1/4 cup almond milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and grease a doughnut pan. 2. In a bowl, mix oats, flour, baking powder, and baking soda. 3. In another bowl, mix mashed banana, honey, almond milk, and vanilla extract. 4. Combine the wet and dry ingredients until just mixed. 5. Fill the doughnut pan with batter and bake for 15-18 minutes. 6. Let them cool before serving.

Description: A refreshing, zesty doughnut made with whole ingredients, perfect for a light snack or breakfast.
Ingredients: 1 cup whole wheat flour, 2 tbsp poppy seeds, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/4 tsp salt, juice and zest of 1 lemon, 1/4 cup honey, 1/4 cup unsweetened almond milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and grease a doughnut pan. 2. In a bowl, mix flour, poppy seeds, baking powder, and salt. 3. In another bowl, whisk together lemon juice, zest, honey, almond milk, and vanilla. 4. Combine wet and dry ingredients until just mixed. 5. Fill the doughnut pan and bake for 12-15 minutes. 6. Cool on a wire rack and serve.

Description: Perfectly spiced for fall, these doughnuts are made with pumpkin puree and warm spices for a cozy treat.
Ingredients: 1 cup whole wheat flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp pumpkin spice, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/2 cup pumpkin puree, 1/4 cup honey, 1/4 cup almond milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and prepare a doughnut pan. 2. In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, pumpkin spice, and salt. 3. In another bowl, mix pumpkin puree, honey, almond milk, and vanilla until smooth. 4. Combine wet and dry ingredients until just mixed. 5. Spoon batter into doughnut pan and bake for 15 minutes. 6. Allow to cool before serving.

Description: Soft, chewy cookies loaded with wholesome oats and sweet raisins for a delicious treat.
Ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats. � cup whole wheat flour. � teaspoon baking soda. � teaspoon cinnamon. � teaspoon salt. � cup unsweetened applesauce. � cup honey. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. � cup raisins. � cup chopped walnuts (optional)
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. 2. In a bowl, combine rolled oats, whole wheat flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. 3. In another bowl, mix together applesauce, honey, and vanilla extract until well combined. 4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture and stir until just combined. Fold in raisins and walnuts if using. 5. Drop tablespoon-sized amounts of dough onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart. 6. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool on a wire rack.

Description: Naturally sweetened with ripe bananas and packed with protein from peanut butter, these cookies are a healthier choice.
Ingredients: 1 cup natural peanut butter. 2 ripe bananas, mashed. � cup rolled oats. � cup honey. � teaspoon baking powder. � teaspoon salt. � teaspoon vanilla extract. � cup dark chocolate chips (optional)
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. 2. In a bowl, mix together peanut butter and mashed bananas until smooth. 3. Add in rolled oats, honey, baking powder, salt, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined. 4. Fold in dark chocolate chips if using. 5. Drop tablespoon-sized amounts onto the prepared baking sheet. 6. Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are lightly browned. Cool on a wire rack.

Description: A delightful mix of almond butter and dark chocolate that satisfies cravings in a heart-healthy way.
Ingredients: � cup almond butter. � cup coconut flour. � cup maple syrup. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. � teaspoon baking soda. � teaspoon salt. � cup dark chocolate chips.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and prepare a baking sheet with parchment paper. 2. In a mixing bowl, combine almond butter, coconut flour, maple syrup, vanilla extract, baking soda, and salt. Mix until a dough forms. 3. Stir in dark chocolate chips until evenly distributed. 4. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto the baking sheet, spacing them apart. 5. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden. Let cool before serving.

Description: Light and fluffy cookies made with coconut flour for a gluten-free, heart-healthy option.
Ingredients: 1 cup coconut flour. � cup coconut oil, melted. � cup honey or agave syrup. 3 eggs. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. � teaspoon baking powder. � teaspoon salt.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350�F (175�C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. 2. In a bowl, whisk together coconut flour, baking powder, and salt. 3. In another bowl, mix melted coconut oil, honey, eggs, and vanilla extract until smooth. 4. Slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until combined. 5. Drop tablespoon-sized cookies onto the lined sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes until lightly golden. Cool on a wire rack.

Description: Rich and fudgy cookies made with avocado for a creamy, healthy fat alternative.
Ingredients: 1 ripe avocado, mashed. � cup cocoa powder. � cup honey. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. 1 egg. � teaspoon baking soda. � teaspoon salt. � cup dark chocolate chips.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C) and prepare a baking sheet with parchment paper. 2. In a bowl, combine mashed avocado, cocoa powder, honey, vanilla extract, and egg until smooth. 3. Add baking soda and salt, mixing until combined. 4. Fold in dark chocolate chips. 5. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto the baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack.

Description: A delicious and nutritious dumpling filled with spinach and feta cheese, perfect for a healthy meal or snack.
Ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour. � cup water. 1 cup fresh spinach, chopped. � cup feta cheese, crumbled. 1 teaspoon olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste. 1 clove garlic, minced.
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, mix the whole wheat flour with water to form a dough. Knead for about 5 minutes until smooth. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes. 2. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and saut� until fragrant. Add spinach, cooking until wilted. 3. In a bowl, combine the saut�ed spinach with feta, salt, and pepper. 4. Roll out the dough and cut into circles. Place a tablespoon of filling in the center of each circle, fold and pinch to seal. 5. Boil dumplings in salted water for about 5 minutes until they float. Serve warm.

Description: A hearty dumpling filled with protein-rich lentils and earthy mushrooms, great for any meal.
Ingredients: 1 cup cooked lentils. 1 cup mushrooms, finely chopped. 1 cup whole wheat flour. � cup water. 1 tablespoon olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Add cooked lentils, salt, and pepper. Mix well and cook for another 2-3 minutes. 2. In a bowl, combine whole wheat flour with water to form a dough. Knead for about 5 minutes until smooth. 3. Roll out the dough and cut into circles. Place a tablespoon of filling in the center, fold, and seal. 4. Steam dumplings for 10-12 minutes or until cooked through. Serve warm with a dipping sauce.

Recipe Name: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Dumplings
Description: These vibrant dumplings combine sweet potatoes and black beans for a flavorful and healthy treat.
Ingredients: 1 cup sweet potato, mashed. 1 cup canned black beans, rinsed and drained. 1 cup whole wheat flour. � cup water. 1 teaspoon cumin. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. Boil sweet potatoes until soft, then mash them in a bowl. Mash black beans and combine with sweet potato, adding cumin, salt, and pepper. 2. In a separate bowl, mix whole wheat flour with water, knead to form a dough. 3. Roll dough into circles, placing about a tablespoon of filling in the center. Fold and seal. 4. Fry in a non-stick pan with a little olive oil until golden brown on both sides. Serve hot.

Description: A plant-based dumpling filled with tofu and a medley of vegetables, perfect for a light meal.
Ingredients: 1 cup firm tofu, crumbled. 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, bell peppers). 1 cup whole wheat flour. � cup water. 1 tablespoon soy sauce. 1 teaspoon sesame oil.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix crumbled tofu, mixed vegetables, soy sauce, and sesame oil. 2. Combine whole wheat flour with water to form a dough and knead until smooth. 3. Roll out into circles, place a tablespoon of filling in the center, fold, and pinch to seal. 4. Steam for about 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Description: Light and fluffy dumplings seasoned with fresh herbs, perfect as a side dish or light meal.
Ingredients: 1 cup whole wheat flour. � cup water. 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped. 1 tablespoon fresh chives, chopped. 1 teaspoon baking powder. Salt to taste.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine whole wheat flour, baking powder, chopped herbs, and salt. Mix well. 2. Gradually add water to form a soft dough. 3. Drop spoonfuls of dough into boiling salted water and cook until they float, about 5 minutes. Serve warm with a light broth or sauce.

Description: A crunchy and flavorful appetizer filled with fresh vegetables, perfect for a heart-healthy snack.
Ingredients: 2 cups cabbage, shredded. 1 cup carrots, julienned. 1 cup bell peppers, thinly sliced. 1 cup bean sprouts. 2 green onions, chopped. 1 tablespoon ginger, minced. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 tablespoon soy sauce (low sodium). 1 teaspoon sesame oil. 10 egg roll wrappers.
Instructions: 1. In a large skillet, heat sesame oil over medium heat. 2. Add garlic and ginger, saut� for 1 minute. 3. Add cabbage, carrots, bell peppers, and bean sprouts. Cook for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender. 4. Stir in green onions and soy sauce. 5. Lay an egg roll wrapper on a clean surface and spoon 2 tablespoons of the filling at the center. Fold and seal the edges. 6. Preheat an air fryer or oven to 375�F (190�C). Place egg rolls in a single layer and cook for 12-15 minutes until golden and crispy. Serve warm.

Description: A nutritious option with tofu and spinach wrapped in crispy goodness, ideal for a light dinner or appetizer.
Ingredients: 1 cup firm tofu, crumbled. 2 cups spinach, chopped. 1 cup mushrooms, diced. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 tablespoon soy sauce (low sodium). 1 teaspoon sesame oil. 10 egg roll wrappers.
Instructions: 1. Heat sesame oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. 2. Add garlic and mushrooms, saut� for 3-4 minutes. 3. Stir in tofu and spinach, cook until spinach wilts and tofu is heated through. Mix in soy sauce. 4. Let the filling cool slightly. 5. Spoon filling onto an egg roll wrapper, fold and seal. 6. Cook in an air fryer or oven at 375�F (190�C) for 12-15 minutes until crispy.

Recipe Name: Sweet Potato & Black Bean Egg Rolls
Description: A wholesome combination of sweet potatoes and black beans, these egg rolls are filling and heart-healthy.
Ingredients: 1 cup sweet potato, cooked and mashed. 1 cup black beans, canned, rinsed, and drained. � teaspoon cumin. � teaspoon chili powder. 2 green onions, chopped. 10 egg roll wrappers.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine mashed sweet potatoes, black beans, cumin, chili powder, and green onions. Mix well. 2. Lay an egg roll wrapper on a flat surface, add 2 tablespoons of the filling, and fold/seal. 3. Preheat an air fryer or oven to 375�F (190�C). 4. Cook egg rolls for 12-15 minutes until golden. Serve with salsa or avocado.

Description: Lean chicken mixed with herbs and fresh vegetables, these egg rolls balance nutrition and flavor.
Ingredients: 1 cup cooked chicken, shredded. 1 cup mixed bell peppers, diced. 1 cup zucchini, grated. 1 tablespoon parsley, chopped. 1 teaspoon thyme. 1 tablespoon low-sodium soy sauce. 10 egg roll wrappers.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine the shredded chicken, bell peppers, zucchini, herbs, and soy sauce. Mix until well combined. 2. Place an egg roll wrapper in a diamond shape and add 2 tablespoons of filling. Fold and seal. 3. Preheat air fryer or oven to 375�F (190�C). 4. Cook the egg rolls for 12-15 minutes until crispy. Serve warm.

Description: Savory mushroom and carrot filling in a golden crispy wrapper, a delightful treat for any time of the day.
Ingredients: 1 cup mushrooms, chopped. 1 cup carrots, grated. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 tablespoon soy sauce (low sodium). 1 teaspoon olive oil. 10 egg roll wrappers.
Instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. 2. Add garlic and mushrooms, saut� for 5 minutes. 3. Add carrots and soy sauce, and cook for another 5 minutes until tender. 4. Remove from heat and let cool. 5. Fill egg roll wrappers with the mixture, fold, and seal. 6. Cook in the air fryer or oven at 375�F (190�C) for 12-15 minutes. Enjoy.

Description: A creamy, heart-healthy twist on traditional egg salad, featuring ripe avocado for added nutrients and healthy fats.
Ingredients: 6 hard-boiled eggs, chopped. 1 ripe avocado, mashed. 2 tablespoons plain Greek yogurt. 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard. 2 tablespoons red onion, finely chopped. 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped. Juice of � lemon. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large mixing bowl, combine chopped eggs, mashed avocado, Greek yogurt, Dijon mustard, red onion, dill, and lemon juice. 2. Gently fold the ingredients together until well combined. 3. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 4. Serve chilled on whole grain bread, lettuce, or on its own.

Recipe Name: Egg Salad with Greek Yogurt and Herbs
Description: A lightened-up egg salad that uses Greek yogurt for creaminess and is packed with fresh herbs for a burst of flavor.
Ingredients: 4 hard-boiled eggs, chopped. � cup plain Greek yogurt. 1 tablespoon mayonnaise. 1 tablespoon fresh chives, chopped. 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped. 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine chopped boiled eggs, Greek yogurt, mayonnaise, chives, parsley, and Dijon mustard. 2. Mix until well incorporated. 3. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 4. Chill in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes before serving.

Description: A zesty egg salad with a kick, perfect for those who enjoy a little heat in their meals.
Ingredients: 5 hard-boiled eggs, chopped. 2 tablespoons plain Greek yogurt. 1 tablespoon Sriracha. 1 tablespoon lime juice. 1 tablespoon green onion, chopped. Salt to taste
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix the chopped eggs with Greek yogurt, Sriracha, lime juice, and green onion. 2. Stir to combine until smooth. 3. Add salt to taste. 4. Serve on whole grain toast or lettuce wraps.

Description: A colorful, flavor-packed egg salad featuring olives, tomatoes, and feta cheese for a Mediterranean twist.
Ingredients: 6 hard-boiled eggs, chopped. � cup Kalamata olives, pitted and chopped. � cup cherry tomatoes, halved. � cup feta cheese, crumbled. 2 tablespoons plain Greek yogurt. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine chopped eggs, olives, cherry tomatoes, feta, Greek yogurt, olive oil, and red wine vinegar. 2. Gently mix until combined. 3. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 4. Serve with pita bread or on a bed of greens.

Description: A unique egg salad featuring curry powder for a flavorful and aromatic dish, great for sandwiches or wraps.
Ingredients: 6 hard-boiled eggs, chopped. � cup plain Greek yogurt. 1 tablespoon curry powder. 1 tablespoon mayonnaise. 2 tablespoons green onion, sliced. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine chopped eggs, Greek yogurt, curry powder, mayonnaise, and green onion. 2. Mix well until all ingredients are incorporated. 3. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 4. Serve with whole grain bread or in lettuce cups.

Recipe Name: Eggplant Parmesan with Whole Wheat Breadcrumbs
Description: A classic Italian dish made healthier by baking and using whole wheat breadcrumbs, maintaining a delicious flavor without excess calories.
Ingredients: 2 medium eggplants, sliced into 1/2-inch rounds. 1 � cups whole wheat breadcrumbs. 1 cup marinara sauce. 1 cup part-skim mozzarella cheese, shredded. � cup grated Parmesan cheese. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 teaspoon garlic powder. 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. Sprinkle the eggplant slices with salt and let them sit for about 30 minutes to draw out moisture. Pat dry with paper towels. 3. In a shallow dish, mix whole wheat breadcrumbs, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. 4. Dip each eggplant slice in olive oil, then coat with the breadcrumb mixture. 5. Arrange the pieces on a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes, flipping halfway through. 6. In a baking dish, layer half of the eggplant slices, top with half of the marinara sauce, and sprinkle with half of the mozzarella cheese. 7. Repeat the layers with the remaining eggplant, sauce, and mozzarella. Finish with grated Parmesan. 8. Bake for an additional 20 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Description: A flavorful twist on the traditional dish, enriched with Mediterranean herbs and served with a side of fresh salad.
Ingredients: 2 large eggplants, cut into �-inch slices. 2 cups homemade or low-sodium store-bought marinara sauce. 1 � cups feta cheese, crumbled. 1 � cups whole wheat breadcrumbs. 3 tablespoons olive oil. 1 teaspoon dried oregano. 1 teaspoon dried basil. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. Lightly salt the eggplant slices and let them sit for 30 minutes to draw moisture. Rinse and pat dry. 3. In a bowl, combine breadcrumbs, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. 4. Brush eggplant slices with olive oil, and dredge each slice in the breadcrumb mixture. 5. On a baking sheet, arrange the eggplant slices and bake for 25 minutes, turning halfway through. 6. In a baking dish, layer half of the baked eggplant, half of the marinara sauce, and half of the feta cheese. Repeat layers, finishing with marinara. 7. Bake for 20 minutes until heated through and feta is slightly golden.

Description: A lighter version of eggplant Parmesan that incorporates zucchini for added vegetables and nutrients.
Ingredients: 1 medium eggplant, sliced. 2 medium zucchinis, sliced. 1 � cups crushed tomatoes. 1 cup mozzarella cheese, shredded. 1 cup whole wheat breadcrumbs. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 teaspoon garlic powder. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. Salt the eggplant slices and let sit for 30 minutes. Rinse and dry. 3. In a shallow dish, mix breadcrumbs, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. 4. Dredge eggplant and zucchini slices in olive oil then in breadcrumb mixture. 5. Place slices on a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes, flipping halfway through. 6. In a baking dish, layer half of eggplant, half of zucchini, half of crushed tomatoes, and half of mozzarella. Repeat layers, finishing with mozzarella on top. 7. Bake for 25 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Description: For those who enjoy a bit of heat, this version adds crushed red pepper flakes for flavor.
Ingredients: 2 medium eggplants, sliced into rounds. 1 cup marinara sauce. 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese. 1 cup whole wheat breadcrumbs. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 teaspoon garlic powder. � teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. Salt eggplant slices and allow to draw moisture for 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry. 3. Combine breadcrumbs, garlic powder, crushed red pepper, salt, and pepper in a bowl. 4. Brush eggplant with olive oil, dredge in breadcrumb mixture. 5. Place on baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes, flipping halfway through. 6. Layer half of eggplant slices in a baking dish, top with half marinara and cheese. Repeat layers finishing with cheese. 7. Bake for 20 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Description: This version uses fresh herbs for a fragrant and flavorful dish, perfect for any occasion.
Ingredients: 2 medium eggplants, sliced. 2 cups marinara sauce. 1 cup shredded part-skim mozzarella. 1 cup whole wheat breadcrumbs. 3 tablespoons olive oil. 2 tablespoons fresh basil, chopped. 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped. Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. Salt the eggplant slices for 30 minutes to extract moisture. Rinse and pat dry. 3. In a bowl, combine breadcrumbs, basil, parsley, salt, and pepper. 4. Brush the eggplant with olive oil, then coat with the breadcrumb mixture. 5. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes, flipping halfway. 6. Layer half of the eggplant in a baking dish, top with half of the marinara and half of the cheese. Repeat with the remaining ingredients. 7. Bake for 20 minutes until bubbly.

Description: A delicious, flaky pastry filled with nutritious spinach and tangy feta cheese, perfect for a heart-healthy snack or light meal.
Ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour, � teaspoon salt, � cup olive oil, 6 tablespoons cold water, 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped, 1 cup feta cheese, crumbled, � teaspoon black pepper, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 egg (for egg wash)
Instructions: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour and salt. 2. Add olive oil and mix until crumbly. 3. Stir in cold water gradually until the dough forms. 4. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes. 5. Preheat oven to 375�F (190�C). 6. In a skillet, saut� spinach until wilted, then combine with feta, black pepper, and garlic powder. 7. Roll out the dough, cut into circles, fill with spinach mixture, fold, and seal edges. 8. Brush with egg wash and bake for 25-30 minutes until golden.

Recipe Name: Empanadas with Black Beans and Corn
Description: A hearty, flavorful pastry filled with protein-rich black beans, sweet corn, and spices for a satisfying meal.
Ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, � teaspoon salt, � cup olive oil, 6 tablespoons cold water, 1 cup canned black beans, rinsed and drained, 1 cup corn kernels, 1 teaspoon cumin, � teaspoon chili powder, 1 tablespoon lime juice
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour, baking powder, and salt. 2. Stir in olive oil and cold water to form a dough. 3. Chill the dough for 30 minutes. 4. In a separate bowl, combine black beans, corn, cumin, chili powder, and lime juice. 5. Roll out the dough, cut into circles, fill with the mixture, fold, and seal. 6. Bake at 375�F (190�C) for 25-30 minutes until golden.

Description: A comforting pastry filled with lean chicken and creamy avocado, making for a satisfying meal.
Ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour, 1 teaspoon salt, � cup coconut oil, 6 tablespoons cold water, 1 cup cooked chicken, shredded, 1 ripe avocado, diced, 1 teaspoon lime juice, � teaspoon cumin, � teaspoon paprika
Instructions: 1. Combine whole wheat flour and salt in a bowl. 2. Add coconut oil and mix until crumbly. 3. Gradually add cold water to form dough, then chill for 30 minutes. 4. In a bowl, mix chicken, avocado, lime juice, cumin, and paprika. 5. Roll out the dough, cut into circles, fill with chicken mixture, fold and seal. 6. Bake at 375�F (190�C) for 25-30 minutes until golden.

Description: A nutritious filling of lentils and mixed vegetables, perfect for a wholesome and filling snack.
Ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, � teaspoon salt, � cup olive oil, 6 tablespoons cold water, 1 cup cooked lentils, 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, peppers), 1 teaspoon oregano, � teaspoon black pepper
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, and salt. 2. Add olive oil and gradually mix in cold water to form a dough. 3. Chill for 30 minutes. 4. In a bowl, combine lentils, mixed vegetables, oregano, and black pepper. 5. Roll out the dough, cut into circles, fill with lentil mixture, fold and seal. 6. Bake at 375�F (190�C) for 25-30 minutes until golden brown.

Description: A delicious combination of roasted cauliflower and low-fat cheese encased in a hearty dough, perfect for any time of the day.
Ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour, � teaspoon salt, � cup canola oil, 6 tablespoons cold water, 2 cups cauliflower florets, roasted, 1 cup low-fat cheese, shredded, � teaspoon garlic powder, � teaspoon black pepper
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine whole wheat flour and salt. 2. Add canola oil and mix until crumbly. 3. Gradually add cold water to form a dough and chill for 30 minutes. 4. In a bowl, mix roasted cauliflower, cheese, garlic powder, and black pepper. 5. Roll out dough, cut into circles, fill with cauliflower mixture, fold and seal. 6. Bake at 375�F (190�C) for 25-30 minutes until golden.

Description: A wholesome twist on traditional enchiladas, packed with spinach and black beans, perfect for a healthy dinner option.
Ingredients: 8 small corn tortillas, 2 cups fresh spinach, 1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained, 1 cup low-sodium enchilada sauce, 1 cup low-fat cheese, shredded, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garlic powder, Salt and pepper to taste, Fresh cilantro for garnish
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. In a pan, saut� spinach until wilted. 3. In a bowl, mix black beans, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and pepper with the saut�ed spinach. 4. Fill each tortilla with the mixture, roll up, and place seam-side down in a baking dish. 5. Pour enchilada sauce over the top and sprinkle with cheese. 6. Bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. 7. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

Description: A delightful blend of shredded chicken and mixed vegetables wrapped in corn tortillas, topped with a zesty enchilada sauce.
Ingredients: 2 cups shredded cooked chicken, 1 cup bell peppers, diced, 1 cup zucchini, diced, 8 small corn tortillas, 1 cup low-sodium enchilada sauce, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 cup low-fat cheese, shredded, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350�F (175�C). 2. In a bowl, combine chicken, bell peppers, zucchini, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. 3. Fill tortillas with the chicken mixture, roll them up, and place in a baking dish. 4. Pour enchilada sauce over, sprinkle cheese on top. 5. Bake for 25 minutes or until cheese is bubbly. Serve warm.

Recipe Name: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Enchiladas
Description: A hearty and nutritious meal with sweet potatoes and black beans, wrapped in tortillas and baked with a savory sauce.
Ingredients: 1 cup sweet potatoes, cooked and mashed, 1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained, 8 small corn tortillas, 1 cup low-sodium enchilada sauce, 1 tsp cumin, 1/2 tsp chili powder, Salt to taste, 1 cup low-fat cheese, shredded
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. In a bowl, mix mashed sweet potatoes, black beans, cumin, chili powder, and salt. 3. Fill tortillas with the mixture, roll them up, and place in a baking dish. 4. Pour enchilada sauce over the top and sprinkle with cheese. 5. Bake for 20-25 minutes until cheese is fully melted.

Description: Fresh and vibrant vegetable enchiladas served with a smooth avocado cream for a delicious and healthy touch.
Ingredients: 1 cup mushrooms, diced, 1 cup bell peppers, diced, 1 cup onions, diced, 8 small corn tortillas, 1 cup low-sodium enchilada sauce, 1 avocado, 1/4 cup Greek yogurt, 1 tbsp lime juice, Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. Saut� onions, bell peppers, and mushrooms until tender. 3. Fill tortillas with the saut�ed vegetables, roll up, and place in a baking dish. 4. Pour enchilada sauce over and bake for 20 minutes. 5. In a blender, combine avocado, Greek yogurt, lime juice, salt, and pepper to make the cream. Serve enchiladas topped with avocado cream.

Description: A nutritious option featuring quinoa and black beans in corn tortillas, topped with hearty enchilada sauce.
Ingredients: 1 cup quinoa, cooked, 1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained, 8 small corn tortillas, 1 cup low-sodium enchilada sauce, 1 tsp cumin, 1/2 tsp chili powder, Salt to taste, 1 cup low-fat cheese, shredded
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375�F (190�C). 2. In a bowl, mix cooked quinoa, black beans, cumin, chili powder, and salt. 3. Fill tortillas with the mixture, roll up, and place in a baking dish. 4. Pour enchilada sauce over and top with cheese. 5. Bake for 25 minutes or until cheese is bubbly and golden.

Recipe Name: Energy Balls with Almonds and Oats
Description: A nutritious snack packed with healthy fats and fibers, perfect for an energy boost anytime.
Ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats. � cup almond butter. � cup honey or maple syrup. � cup ground flaxseed. � cup chopped almonds. � teaspoon vanilla extract. Pinch of salt
Instructions: 1. In a large mixing bowl, combine rolled oats, almond butter, honey (or maple syrup), ground flaxseed, chopped almonds, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt. 2. Stir until all ingredients are well combined. 3. Using your hands, roll the mixture into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter. 4. Place the energy balls on a parchment-lined baking sheet and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to set. 5. Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to a week.

Description: A delightful chocolate-flavored energy ball that combines protein and healthy fats, perfect for a quick snack.
Ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats. � cup unsweetened cocoa powder. � cup natural peanut butter. � cup honey. � cup mini dark chocolate chips. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Pinch of salt
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, mix rolled oats, cocoa powder, peanut butter, honey, chocolate chips, vanilla extract, and salt until well combined. 2. Roll the mixture into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter. 3. Place on a plate or tray and refrigerate for about 30 minutes. 4. Store in an airtight container for up to a week.

Description: A tropical twist on energy balls that are rich in omega-3s and antioxidants, ideal for a post-workout snack.
Ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats. � cup chia seeds. � cup shredded coconut, unsweetened. � cup almond butter. � cup honey. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Pinch of salt
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine rolled oats, chia seeds, shredded coconut, almond butter, honey, vanilla extract, and salt. 2. Mix well until all ingredients are fully combined. 3. Roll into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter. 4. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until firm. 5. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week.

Description: Energizing and filled with antioxidants, these energy balls are perfect for a health-conscious snack.
Ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats. 2 tablespoons matcha powder. � cup almond butter. � cup honey. � cup chopped walnuts. 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Pinch of salt
Instructions: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine rolled oats, matcha powder, almond butter, honey, chopped walnuts, vanilla extract, and salt. 2. Stir until the mixture is well blended. 3. Roll the mixture into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter. 4. Refrigerate for 30 minutes until firm. 5. Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to a week.

Description: A delicious pairing of peanut butter and banana, these energy balls are soft, sweet, and satisfying.
Ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats. � cup peanut butter. 1 ripe banana, mashed. � cup honey. � cup ground flaxseed. � cup chopped walnuts. Pinch of salt
Instructions: 1. In a large bowl, mix rolled oats, peanut butter, mashed banana, honey, ground flaxseed, chopped walnuts, and salt until fully combined. 2. Roll into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter. 3. Place on a tray and refrigerate for about 30 minutes. 4. Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to a week.

Recipe Name: Whole Wheat English Muffin with Avocado and Tomato
Description: A nutritious and filling breakfast option topped with creamy avocado and fresh tomato, rich in healthy fats.
Ingredients: 1 whole wheat English muffin, split and toasted. 1 ripe avocado, mashed. 1 medium tomato, sliced. Salt and pepper to taste. Optional: red pepper flakes and lemon juice.
Instructions: 1. Toast the whole wheat English muffin halves until golden brown. 2. In a small bowl, mash the avocado and season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice if desired. 3. Spread the mashed avocado evenly over each muffin half. 4. Top with tomato slices and sprinkle with red pepper flakes for added heat. 5. Serve immediately and enjoy!

Recipe Name: Spinach and Feta English Muffin Sandwich
Description: A deliciously savory open-faced sandwich that combines saut�ed spinach and tangy feta cheese for a healthy lunch.
Ingredients: 1 whole wheat English muffin. 1 cup fresh spinach, cooked. � cup feta cheese, crumbled. 1 tablespoon olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste. Optional: 1 poached egg.
Instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. 2. Add fresh spinach and cook until wilted. Season with salt and pepper. 3. Meanwhile, toast the English muffin until golden. 4. Top each half with cooked spinach and sprinkle with feta cheese. 5. For an added protein boost, top with a poached egg if desired. Serve warm.

Recipe Name: Banana and Almond Butter English Muffin
Description: A quick, satisfying breakfast or snack featuring the perfect combination of banana and almond butter, packed with nutrients.
Ingredients: 1 whole wheat English muffin, split and toasted. 1 medium banana, sliced. 2 tablespoons almond butter. 1 tablespoon chia seeds (optional).
Instructions: 1. Toast the English muffin halves until crispy. 2. Spread almond butter evenly on each half. 3. Top with banana slices and sprinkle with chia seeds if desired. 4. Serve immediately as a filling breakfast or snack.

Description: A flavorful and healthy veggie-packed English muffin sandwich inspired by Mediterranean cuisine, perfect for lunch.
Ingredients: 1 whole wheat English muffin, toasted. � cup hummus. � cup cucumber, sliced. � cup bell pepper, sliced. � cup red onion, thinly sliced. � cup olives, sliced.
Instructions: 1. Toast the whole wheat English muffin halves until golden. 2. Spread hummus generously on each half. 3. Layer cucumber, bell pepper, red onion, and olives on top. 4. Serve open-faced or sandwich-style for a refreshing meal.

Recipe Name: Peanut Butter, Honey, and Cinnamon English Muffin
Description: A delightful twist on breakfast that combines creamy peanut butter, sweet honey, and a hint of cinnamon, it's both filling and heart-healthy.
Ingredients: 1 whole wheat English muffin, split and toasted. 2 tablespoons natural peanut butter. 1 tablespoon honey. � teaspoon ground cinnamon.
Instructions: 1. Toast the English muffin halves until crispy. 2. Spread natural peanut butter evenly on each half. 3. Drizzle honey on top and sprinkle with ground cinnamon. 4. Serve immediately as a delicious breakfast or snack.

Description: A flavorful and zesty dish featuring shrimp in a rich and spicy roux-based sauce, served over rice for a filling meal.
Ingredients: 1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined. � cup whole wheat flour. � cup olive oil. 1 cup onion, diced. 1 cup green bell pepper, diced. 1 cup celery, diced. 3 cloves garlic, minced. 2 cups low-sodium vegetable broth. 1 tablespoon Cajun seasoning. 1 teaspoon paprika. 1 teaspoon thyme. � teaspoon cayenne pepper. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. 2. Add flour to make a roux, stirring continuously for about 10 minutes until golden brown. 3. Mix in onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic, saut� for about 5-7 minutes until softened. 4. Gradually add broth, stirring well to combine, then add Cajun seasoning, paprika, thyme, and cayenne. 5. Bring to a simmer, add the shrimp, and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. 6. Serve over brown rice.

Description: A hearty, vegetable-packed �touff�e that is rich in flavor and perfect for a wholesome meal.
Ingredients: � cup brown rice, uncooked. � cup whole wheat flour. � cup olive oil. 1 cup onion, diced. 1 cup green bell pepper, diced. 1 cup celery, diced. 2 cups mushrooms, sliced. 2 cups low-sodium vegetable broth. 1 tablespoon Cajun seasoning. 1 teaspoon thyme. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. Cook brown rice according to package instructions. 2. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. 3. Add flour to make a roux, stirring continuously for about 10 minutes until golden brown. 4. Mix in onion, bell pepper, celery, and mushrooms, saut�ing for about 5-7 minutes until softened. 5. Gradually add broth, stirring well to combine, then add Cajun seasoning and thyme. 6. Simmer for 10 minutes, season with salt and pepper, and serve over the cooked brown rice.

Description: A lean twist on the classic �touff�e, made with ground turkey for a heart-healthy version.
Ingredients: 1 lb ground turkey. � cup whole wheat flour. � cup olive oil. 1 cup onion, diced. 1 cup green bell pepper, diced. 1 cup celery, diced. 3 cloves garlic, minced. 2 cups low-sodium chicken broth. 1 tablespoon Cajun seasoning. 1 teaspoon thyme. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. 2. Add ground turkey and cook until browned. 3. Stir in flour to create a roux, cooking for about 5 minutes. 4. Add onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic, saut� until vegetables are softened. 5. Gradually add broth and mix in Cajun seasoning and thyme, simmer for about 10 minutes. 6. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve over quinoa or whole grain rice.

Description: A protein-rich vegetarian �touff�e packed with lentils and fresh vegetables for a heart-healthy meal.
Ingredients: 1 cup lentils, rinsed. � cup whole wheat flour. � cup olive oil. 1 cup onion, diced. 1 cup green bell pepper, diced. 1 cup celery, diced. 2 cups low-sodium vegetable broth. 1 tablespoon Cajun seasoning. 1 teaspoon thyme. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. In a pot, cook lentils according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. 2. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat and stir in flour to create a roux, about 5 minutes. 3. Add onion, bell pepper, celery, and saut� for 5-7 minutes. 4. Gradually stir in broth, then mix in the cooked lentils, Cajun seasoning, and thyme. 5. Simmer for about 10 minutes and season with salt and pepper. Serve over whole grain rice or quinoa.

Description: A heart-healthy chicken �touff�e that combines chicken breast with vegetables in a flavorful sauce, served over brown rice.
Ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, diced. � cup whole wheat flour. � cup olive oil. 1 cup onion, diced. 1 cup green bell pepper, diced. 1 cup celery, diced. 3 cloves garlic, minced. 2 cups low-sodium chicken broth. 1 tablespoon Cajun seasoning. 1 teaspoon paprika. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. 2. Add the diced chicken and cook until no longer pink. 3. Stir in the flour to create a roux and cook for about 5 minutes. 4. Add in the onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic, saut� for about 5-7 minutes. 5. Gradually add broth, then mix in Cajun seasoning and paprika, simmer for 10 minutes. 6. Season with salt and pepper and serve over brown rice.

Description: A flavorful Middle Eastern dish made from ground chickpeas, herbs, and spices, served with a creamy tahini sauce.
Ingredients: 1 cup dried chickpeas, soaked overnight. 1 small onion, chopped. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 cup fresh parsley, chopped. 1 teaspoon cumin powder. 1 teaspoon coriander powder. � teaspoon baking powder. Salt and pepper to taste. � cup tahini. 2 tablespoons lemon juice. Water as needed.
Instructions: 1. Drain and rinse the soaked chickpeas. 2. In a food processor, combine chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cumin, coriander, baking powder, salt, and pepper. Blend until a coarse mixture forms. 3. Shape the mixture into small balls or patties. 4. Heat a pan with a little oil over medium heat and cook the falafel until golden brown on each side, about 4-5 minutes. 5. In a separate bowl, whisk tahini with lemon juice and add water to reach a desired consistency. Serve falafel with tahini sauce.

Description: A delicious wrap filled with crispy falafel, fresh vegetables, and a spread of creamy hummus.
Ingredients: 1 cup falafel mix (prepared as per previous recipe). 2 whole wheat tortillas. � cup hummus. 1 cup mixed greens. 1 medium tomato, sliced. � cucumber, sliced. � cup shredded carrots.
Instructions: 1. Prepare the falafel mixture and form into balls as described previously. 2. Cook falafel until golden brown. 3. Spread hummus onto each tortilla. 4. Layer with mixed greens, tomato, cucumber, and carrots. 5. Place falafel on top, wrap tightly, and serve.

Description: A healthier version of falafel, baked instead of fried, and spiced up for a tasty kick.
Ingredients: 1 cup dried chickpeas, soaked overnight. 1 small onion, chopped. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 tablespoon sriracha or chili paste. 1 teaspoon cumin powder. 1 teaspoon paprika. � teaspoon baking powder. Salt and pepper to taste. 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400�F (200�C). 2. Drain and rinse the chickpeas. 3. Blend chickpeas, onion, garlic, sriracha, cumin, paprika, baking powder, salt, and pepper in a food processor until a coarse mixture forms. 4. Shape into patties and place on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. 5. Drizzle with olive oil and bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden.

Description: A nourishing salad combined with crispy falafel, fresh vegetables, and a tangy dressing.
Ingredients: 1 cup falafel (prepared as above). 2 cups mixed salad greens. � cup cherry tomatoes, halved. � cucumber, sliced. � cup red onion, thinly sliced. � cup feta cheese (optional). 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. Prepare falafel as per recipe. 2. In a large bowl, combine salad greens, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and feta cheese. 3. In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper together. 4. Top the salad with falafel and drizzle with dressing before serving.

Description: A heart-healthy twist on burgers, packed with plant-based protein and flavor.
Ingredients: 1 cup falafel mix (prepared as per previous recipe). 2 whole grain burger buns. � avocado, sliced. 1 cup spinach leaves. 1 medium tomato, sliced. � teaspoon garlic powder. Salt and pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. Prepare the falafel mix and shape into burger patties. 2. Cook the patties in a non-stick skillet over medium heat until golden brown on both sides. 3. Toast the burger buns lightly. 4. Assemble each burger with a patty, avocado, spinach, and tomato. 5. Season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper, and serve.

Recipe Name: Fettuccini with Spinach and Cherry Tomatoes
Description: A light and vibrant pasta dish packed with nutrients from fresh spinach and cherry tomatoes, perfect for a heart-healthy meal.
Ingredients: 8 oz fettuccini. 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped. 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes. Salt and pepper to taste. � cup grated Parmesan cheese (optional)
Instructions: 1. Cook the fettuccini according to package directions until al dente. Drain and set aside. 2. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat and add garlic and red pepper flakes. Saut� until fragrant. 3. Add cherry tomatoes and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes. 4. Stir in the chopped spinach and cook until wilted. 5. Toss in the fettuccini, season with salt and pepper, and mix well. Serve topped with Parmesan cheese if desired.

Description: A creamy and flavorful pasta dish featuring a vibrant avocado pesto, great for a healthy lunch or dinner option.
Ingredients: 8 oz fettuccini. 1 ripe avocado. 1 cup fresh basil leaves. 2 tablespoons lemon juice. 2 cloves garlic. � cup olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste. � cup cherry tomatoes, halved for serving
Instructions: 1. Cook the fettuccini according to package directions. Drain and set aside. 2. In a food processor, combine avocado, basil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth, drizzling in olive oil until combined. 3. Toss the fettuccini with the avocado pesto until fully coated. Serve with cherry tomatoes on top.

Description: A colorful pasta dish that incorporates assorted grilled vegetables, making it robust and heart-healthy.
Ingredients: 8 oz fettuccini. 1 zucchini, sliced. 1 bell pepper, sliced. 1 medium eggplant, diced. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning. Salt and pepper to taste. � cup fresh basil, chopped for garnish
Instructions: 1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Toss sliced vegetables with olive oil, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Grill until tender, about 5-7 minutes. 2. Cook fettuccini according to package directions. Drain and set aside. 3. Toss the cooked fettuccini with the grilled veggies and garnish with fresh basil before serving.

Description: A bright, zesty pasta dish that comes together quickly and is full of fiber and flavor.
Ingredients: 8 oz fettuccini. 2 cups broccoli florets. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1 lemon, zested and juiced. 2 cloves garlic, minced. Salt and pepper to taste. � cup Parmesan cheese for serving (optional)
